"We set our plans for the year ahead, we‚Äôve got our months mapped out and our weekly targets and goals in front of us.
-
What happens when things just don‚Äôt work out?
Won‚Äôt ‚Äòwhat‚Äôs meant to be‚Äô kinda just sort itself out anyway?
Where do our actions come into God‚Äôs plans?
-
I have always struggled with this.
I‚Äôve been a planner, a goal setter, a schedule maker and the leader of the ‚Äòonly dead fish go with the flow‚Äô club.
-
If we want something to happen, we‚Äôve got to plan the hell out of our future and set dates, targets and goals for every accomplishment! Right?
-
What happens when your fool-proof plan to get married at 24 falls flat on it‚Äôs face and you‚Äôre single at 35?!
-
Maybe you were meant to have a million bucks in your bank account by the end of 2019 and you‚Äôre only about a million off a couple of weeks out üí∏
-
When our perfectly thought out plans don‚Äôt end up like we wanted them to, we can easily fall into the trap of becoming down-cast, feeling we‚Äôre not worthy of our dreams or aren‚Äôt good enough to see them come true.
-
Keep your heads up! It‚Äôs the dreams that haven‚Äôt eventuated that can actually bring the greatest blessing. How many times have you looked back and been grateful your prayers haven‚Äôt been answered (hindsight is a beautiful thing!)
-
Your plans haven‚Äôt come to pass because you needed to be in this very situation you‚Äôre in right now. This moment in time sets you up for your future. There is something you need to learn and equip yourself with for the season ahead.
-
We want our precious plans to work out.
God wants our trust to be in Him and his plans.
-
Because, whether we like it or not, He has the best plans for us and is guiding each and every step of the way.
-
Set goals, create plans and use what you‚Äôve been given to the very best of your ability.
-
Then throughout the journey trust God and his perfect path and timing.
-
You‚Äôre meant to be exactly where you are right now.
-
Keep those dreams alive and achieve your impossible while trusting the journey you‚Äôre on and the one who‚Äôs guiding you through it.
-
Pete @peterjbone #achievetheimpossible

"FROM COMFORT TO CALLING
Feeling comfortable is great. Knowing exactly what you‚Äôre doing, where you‚Äôre going and how to get there.
-
6 years ago, I remember telling someone how comfortable I was in my Teaching job. I knew what I was doing, I knew I was good at it, I was passionate about it and I worked alongside amazing people.
-
This comfort was destroyed when Mum and Dad sat me down in the lounge room in late Nov 2013 and told me Dad had just been diagnosed with terminal Pancreatic Cancer and was given just a few months left to live.
-
My dreams of setting Mum and Dad up with a beautiful property to retire on had burst like a balloon.
-
My comfortable lifestyle was the thing that had kept me from pursuing my ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô dreams.
-
We can become comfortable in our jobs, our relationships, our finances, our purpose, our roles and responsibilities as well as our contribution to the world around us.
-
Sometimes God will destroy that comfort to encourage us to step into our calling. This can seem harsh, unfair and unjust.
-
But it‚Äôs often that little push you need to obey your hearts desires and start to pursue your purpose and true calling.
-
For me, pursuing my purpose outworked itself in starting an Instagram account called @achievetheimpossible.
-
Today, I have the blessing and honour to have a platform that inspires and encourages millions of people around the world every single week to achieve their own impossible and pursue their calling.
-
The ‚Äò2020 VISION‚Äô event I‚Äôm involved in this weekend at the beautiful @ritzcarltonkapalua with @msrielly and @liveyourstandard is an example of this.
-
When you‚Äôre brave enough to step out of the comfortable, God can work through you to enable your calling.
-
Be grateful in the seasons of discomfort. God is using them to stretch and grow your capacity to be able to become the person your dreams need you to be.
-
Pete @peterjbone | #achievetheimpossible"

"‚ÄúAs a runner, you typically have a few pairs of shoes you‚Äôre rotating through. You may need a different shoe for long runs, another shoe for speed. We might run through a pair in a month and a half. So ideally, you‚Äôd have different types that meet different needs, but each pair would be recyclable. A shoe like this could mean that I‚Äôm not chucking 10 pairs of shoes in landfill every year.‚Äù ‚Å£
‚Å£
Founder of @GirlsRunNYC, @JessieZapo is one of 200 [FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] beta-testers. She gave heaps of feedback on GEN 1 and returned it to us.  We remade it into Jessie‚Äôs GEN 2. Zero performance lost. Zero plastic waste. One step closer on our journey to end plastic waste.‚Å£
‚Å£
[FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] Made to be remade. ‚Å£

#adidasRunners"
"‚ÄúJust 5 to 10 years ago, if you owned more than 20 pairs of shoes you were whack. You had a problem. Then it was normal to own 20, then 50, then 100 plus. We have to change our thinking to the opposite. Let‚Äôs give back the shoes instead of keeping them in the closet. I think we‚Äôre still quite far off from that sort of thinking being widely accepted, but the shift will happen fast if the whole industry backs into it.‚Äù¬†‚Å£
‚Å£
GEN 1 beta-tester and founder of @StapleDesign, @JeffStaple lives for releases. We heard his thoughts on [FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] and ideas on the future of the footwear industry. He gave back his GEN 1 and we remade it into his GEN 2. Zero plastic waste and one step closer to a culture of less.¬†‚Å£
‚Å£
[FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] Made to be remade.‚Å£
‚Å£
#FUTURECRAFT LOOP"
"‚ÄúWhen I first heard about [FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] I was skeptical. There‚Äôs a lot of greenwashing around, and I like to dig deeper. GEN 1 is 100% recyclable and although there‚Äôs no waste created, GEN 2 still means adding virgin plastic into the stream, which isn‚Äôt going to work in the long run. My question is - at what stage do we reach 1:1 recyclability? That being said, I do think it‚Äôs really important that big companies invest in this kind of innovation. This generation of the shoe might not offer the complete solution yet, but it could get us there. I have my fingers crossed for the future.‚Äù ‚Å£
‚Å£
[FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] GEN 1 beta-tester @SophieHellyer is a surfer, writer and environmentalist. She gave her critique when she handed back her GEN 1 for regeneration into GEN 2. We thank her for holding us to account on every step of our journey to eliminating virgin plastic and ending plastic waste.¬†‚Å£
‚Å£
[FUTURECRAFT.LOOP] Made to be remade.¬†‚Å£

#FUTURECRAFT LOOP"

We try to make dinner together as a family...in hopes that someday our kids will take over #ad. Which is why we try to instill good eating habits and an honest awareness for what‚Äôs inside their food. Thanks, @lightlifefoods for making honesty a part of your message while you make honestly good plant-based burgers. What are some of the most honest conversations you‚Äôve had with your kids? Share with us using #ATasteOfHonesty
üòä
The holidays are in full force now and the kids have been incredibly excited to relax and enjoy the warm glow that only a beautifully lit christmas tree can provide #ad. So much so that they‚Äôve eagerly been awaiting the days that they can fall asleep to holiday movies under that very glow. Thanks to #CasetaSmartLighting by @lutronelectronics smart light switches and plugs we‚Äôre able to let all of this naturally happen while having the option to turn off the tree without risk of awakening a deep slumber.  #SwitchToCaseta
#ad The holidays are upon us and instead of burning holes in our wallets, we've learned a few things over the years. We're able to pinch pennies by grabbing next year's holiday decorations at end of season sales. Also, with all of the credit card usage during the season, we have a bit more peace of mind knowing that since @creditkarma is helping us monitor our credit, we're also able to easily spot potential fraud across our credit accounts.
I‚Äôve been reminiscing over older photos since I‚Äôm so swamped with a particular project that grows in complexity each and every day. Perfectionism is not the only issue, completionism (making up a word here) seems to be the substance that might make it seem that I‚Äôm in suspended animation. I hope you all had a wonderful holiday last week (for those that celebrate it).
üòä
We've reimagined this scene incorporating the spirit of @lightlifefoods campaign about honesty being the best policy in parenting and in food #ad. As fate would have it just last week our middle two children gave us an opportunity to do just that. Our two middle children were laughing up a storm during their quiet times (a time where they‚Äôre *supposed* to nap). We felt like their bond together was more important than a singular nap so we let the laughter fly. This was a mistake. Fast forward a few hours to bed times to when we walked Elle to her room and we found tufts of hair showered across the floor. Insert the opportunity for a seriously honest parenting moment.  What honest conversations have you had with your kids? #ATasteOfHonesty

Ÿ§- ŸÜÿ∂ŸäŸÅ ÿßŸÑŸÅÿßŸÜŸäŸÑÿß ŸàÿßŸÑŸÉÿßŸÉÿßŸà ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸàÿØÿ±ÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÅÿ∂ŸÑ ŸäŸÜÿÆŸÑ ŸàŸäÿÆŸÑÿ∑ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ≥ÿ±ÿπÿ© ÿÆŸÅŸäŸÅÿ© ÿ®ÿ≥ ŸäÿÆÿ™ŸÑÿ∑ ŸÖÿπ ÿÆŸÑŸäÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿ∂.
Ÿ•- ŸÜÿ∂ŸäŸÅ ÿÆŸÑŸäÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ≤ÿ®ÿØÿ© ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ŸàŸÉŸàŸÑÿßÿ™Ÿá ŸÑŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿ∂ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿØŸÅÿπÿ™ŸäŸÜ ŸàŸÜÿÆŸÑÿ∑ ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±ÿµ ÿ•ŸÜŸá ŸÖÿßŸäŸÉŸàŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ∂ÿ±ÿ® ÿπÿ¥Ÿàÿßÿ¶Ÿä ÿ£Ÿà ÿ¥ÿØŸäÿØ. (ŸÖŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ™ÿÆŸÑÿ∑ŸàŸÜŸá ÿ®ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ ŸÖÿ∂ÿ±ÿ® ÿßŸÑŸÉŸäŸÉ ÿßŸÑŸÉŸáÿ±ÿ®ÿßÿ¶Ÿä ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿ£ŸÇŸÑ ÿ≥ÿ±ÿπÿ© Ÿàÿ£ŸÇŸÑ ŸàŸÇÿ™).
Ÿ¶-ÿ™ÿÆÿ®ÿ≤ ŸÅŸä ÿ≠ŸÖÿßŸÖ ŸÖÿßÿ¶Ÿä * ŸÑŸÖÿØÿ© Ÿ§Ÿ† ŸÑŸ•Ÿ†ÿØŸÇŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÖŸÖŸÉŸÜ ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ÿ≠ÿ≥ÿ® ŸÅÿ±ŸÜŸÉ.(ÿ™ŸèÿÆÿ™ÿ®ÿ± ÿ®ÿπŸàÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ŸÜÿßŸÜ )
Ÿ®- ÿ™ÿ™ÿ±ŸÉ ÿ™ÿ®ÿ±ÿØ ŸÅŸä ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ ÿßŸÑÿµŸäŸÜŸäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿ≠ÿ±ÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ∫ÿ±ŸÅÿ© ÿ´ŸÖ ÿ™ÿØÿÆŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÑÿßÿ¨ÿ© ŸÑÿ≥ÿßÿπÿ™ŸäŸÜ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÇŸÑ ÿ£Ÿà ŸÇÿ®ŸÑ ÿ®ŸäŸàŸÖ ŸÑÿ£ŸÅÿ∂ŸÑ ŸÜÿ™Ÿäÿ¨ÿ©.
Ÿ©- ÿπŸÜÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ™ŸÇÿØŸäŸÖ ÿ™ÿ±ÿ¥ ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÉÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸàÿØÿ±ÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÉÿßŸÉÿßŸà ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸàÿØÿ±ÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ÿ≤ŸäŸÜ ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ±ŸäŸÖÿ© ÿ£Ÿà ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÅŸàÿßŸÉŸá ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ŸÇÿØŸÖ ÿ¨ŸÜÿ® ÿßŸÑÿßŸäÿ≥ŸÉÿ±ŸäŸÖ ÿ≠ÿ≥ÿ® ÿ±ÿ∫ÿ®ÿ™ŸÉŸÖ Ÿàÿ®ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÅŸäÿ©‚ô•Ô∏è .
ŸÖŸÑÿßÿ≠ÿ∏ÿßÿ™:
Ÿ°-ÿßŸÑŸÉŸäŸÉÿ© ŸÑŸáÿß ÿ∑ÿ±ŸäŸÇÿ™ŸäŸÜ ŸÑŸÑÿÆÿ®ÿ≤ :
* ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸàŸÑŸâ ŸÖŸÜ ÿØŸàŸÜ ÿ≠ŸÖÿßŸÖ ŸÖÿßÿ¶Ÿä Ÿàÿ™ÿÆÿ®ÿ≤ ŸÖÿ´ŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÉŸäŸÉ ŸÑŸÖÿØÿ© Ÿ¢Ÿ• ŸÑŸÄŸ£Ÿ†ÿØŸÇŸäŸÇÿ© ÿ™ŸÇÿ±Ÿäÿ®Ÿãÿß ..ÿ±ÿßÿ≠ ŸäŸÜÿ™ÿ¨ ÿ™ÿ¥ŸÇŸÇ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿ∑ÿ≠ Ÿàÿ∑ÿ®ŸÇÿ© ŸÖŸÇÿ±ŸÖÿ¥Ÿá ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± (ŸÉÿ´Ÿäÿ± ŸäŸÅÿ∂ŸÑ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ¥ŸÉŸÑ)
* ÿßŸÑÿ∑ÿ±ŸäŸÇÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ´ÿßŸÜŸäÿ©: ŸÅŸä ÿ≠ŸÖÿßŸÖ ŸÖÿßÿ¶Ÿä ÿ≥ÿ∑ÿ≠ ÿÆÿßŸÑŸä ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ¥ŸÇŸÇ ÿ£Ÿà ÿ™ÿ¥ŸÇŸÇ ÿ®ÿ≥Ÿäÿ∑/ ŸÇÿ±ŸÖÿ¥ÿ© ÿ≥ÿ∑ÿ≠ ÿ£ÿÆŸÅ ÿ™ÿ≠ÿ™ÿßÿ¨ Ÿ§Ÿ† ŸÑŸ•Ÿ† ÿ£Ÿà Ÿ¶Ÿ† ÿØŸÇŸäŸÇÿ© ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ ÿ™ÿ≥ÿ™ŸàŸä.
Ÿ¢- ŸäŸÅÿ∂ŸÑ ÿπŸÖŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÉŸäŸÉÿ© ÿ®ÿµŸäŸÜŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ¥Ÿäÿ≤ ŸÉŸäŸÉ Ÿàÿ™ÿ®ÿ∑ŸäŸÜŸáÿß ÿ®Ÿàÿ±ŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿÆŸéÿ®ÿ≤ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸáŸàŸÜ ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ≤ÿ®ÿØÿ© ..ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ Ÿäÿ≥ŸáŸÑ ÿπŸÑŸäŸÉŸÖ ŸÜŸÇŸÑŸáÿß ŸÑÿ≥ÿ∑ÿ≠ ÿßŸÑÿ™ŸÇÿØŸäŸÖ.

"‚ÄúI know I‚Äôm a handful baby‚Äù, part of the new series ‚ÄúRelationship status:‚Äù, where we (@wheresaddie and @aialahernando) use self portraiture as a means of translating/exploring the private as public female experience. 
The artists use site specific real floral arrangements, alongside contemporary artifacts within the artists‚Äô lived experiences; the personal objects strewn across the works serve both as a portrait of the modern women but also of the artists themselves, to create a feeling of longing in the work- to see what is concealed, to understand who is attached. This form of active looking implicates the viewer into the process and highlights further into the series, the role of desire as a (un)productive force.

#addiewagenknecht #aialahernando"
Stillness in movement. A rare capture of a moving figure that evokes a sort of noiselessness reality. An attempt to scape the corporeal existence, a search for more than what the camera can catch. Like a humble Degas, a figure leaving the canvas is not caught in time but passing through time. (Outtake of @cocoowino for @kinfolk)
"‚ÄúI know I tend to make it about me‚Äù, part of the new series ‚ÄúRelationship status:‚Äù, where we (@wheresaddie and @aialahernando) use self portraiture as a means of translating/exploring the private as public female experience. 
The artists use site specific real floral arrangements, alongside contemporary artifacts within the artists‚Äô lived experiences; the personal objects strewn across the works serve both as a portrait of the modern women but also of the artists themselves, to create a feeling of longing in the work- to see what is concealed, to understand who is attached. This form of active looking implicates the viewer into the process and highlights further into the series, the role of desire as a (un)productive force.

#addiewagenknecht #aialahernando"
"‚ÄúI want all of you all strings attached‚Äù, part of the new series ‚ÄúRelationship status:‚Äù, where we (@wheresaddie and @aialahernando) use self portraiture as a means of translating/exploring the private as public female experience. The artists use site specific real floral arrangements, alongside contemporary artifacts within the artists‚Äô lived experiences; the personal objects strewn across the works serve both as a portrait of the modern women but also of the artists themselves: healing crystals, prescriptions, diet potions, pregnancy test and other alchemy. The works represent the fantasy of the internet, where images are curated and perfected in order to convey the ideal versions of ourselves- at first you see the living flowers, then you see the old takeout containers, exliers, beauty tools and finally the artists themselves.

#addiewagenknecht #aialahernando"

–ö—Ä—É–∂–µ–≤–æ —à–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–ª—å–∏ vs –ø–∞–π–µ—Ç–∫–∏, –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π —Å–∏–ª—É—ç—Ç —Å –¥–ª–∏–Ω–æ–π –≤ –ø–æ–ª –∏ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–∞—à–Ω—ã–º —Ä—É–∫–∞–≤–æ–º vs –∫–æ—Ä—Å–µ—Ç –∏ –º–∏–Ω–∏ - –≥–∞—Ä–º–æ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ–π –≤ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—å–µ #alenaakhmadullina #SpringSummer20 ‚ú® Chantilly lace vs sequins, historic silhouette vs mini and corset - all this is harmoniously balanced in #alenaakhmadullina #SpringSummer20 dress ‚ú®

"One of the most beautiful things about landmarks is that even if they are incredibly famous, each one of us has his/her own memory, an intimate interpretation of what's seen by millions. ‚ú®
5 years ago I was starting to work as a product designer (that's what I graduated in), but I wasn't really certain about it. That's because deep within myself I knew what I really wanted to do, but I was scared to acknowledge that.ü§ê
Somehow I started posting pictures here on Instagram, and as I wanted to create new content, I visited Paris with my mother & sisters.
I just had a tiny camera with 2 lenses, but I really loved exploring the city and experimenting with my new gear.ü§ì
Among all the places I saw, there was one that really got me: Notre-Dame.üïç
I visited its incredible interiors, went up to its balcony (even if back then I was pretty much afraid of heights), and on the last day, I decided to wake up really early to take a picture with no tourists.
.
That was the first time I woke up before sunrise for taking a photograph.
That was one of the first moments when I realized what I truly wanted to be in my life: a photographer.üì∑
I was so proud of that picture back then [you can see it as a 2nd picture in this post], while I smile when I look at it now. 
I still had so much to learn.
.
I went back to Paris 2 years later, and I couldn't miss the morning meeting with my past muse; so I again woke up early, and I shot the very first lights of day on a pretty cold and windy morning.
It was as beautiful as 2 years earlier.
.
I somehow thought this would become a ""classic appointment"" in my life, a morning meeting every few years with Notre-Dame, in the silence of the dawn, just with the sound of the wind and of the river Seine.
Now though, a vast portion of that majestic beauty has turned to ashes.
It's inexplicable, unbelievable, but sadly true.
.
I am grateful for having had the chance to see you, and portray your unique beauty at the best that I could.
Dear Notre-Dame, your original grace will be deeply missed.üôèüèª"
"Majestic architecture in Berlin, Germany üá©üá™‚ú® [read below the thought behind the shot]‚¨áÔ∏è
__________________________________________
Architectural Photography is not just ""taking pictures of architecture"". Actually, it's all about understanding the essence of the project and translating that on a 2-dimensional plane, a photograph. üì∑
Architects spend years designing, planning, and executing projects of this kind, and we as viewers should stop more often to admire in awe of their work. üòÆ
Here's my suggestion for you: next time you see a beautiful building in your city, try to stop for a second and wonder ""Why is it like this?"" and ""What did the architect want to communicate with this?"".
This will help you open up your mind to a new way of interpretation of what you see.ü§©
#Archilover .
üëèThe architect of this majestic work of art: @stephanbraunfels
üì∑Camera: @sonyalpha a7RII
üî≠Tripod: @siruiimaging N-2204SK"
"When the old meets the new - K√∂ln, Germany üá©üá™‚ú® [read below the full story behind the shot]
__________________________________________
As an #archilover I always find it interesting when new architectures are built close to historical ones. In this picture you can see the K√∂lner Dom, a medieval church built in the 1200, and the three Kranhaus, built in the early 2000s.
‚û°Ô∏è Which one do you prefer?‚ùì
__________________________________________
Fun fact about this shot: I was shooting from a bridge used by trains to cross the river, and it took countless takes in order to get a sharp long exposure, as trains were passing pretty frequently. This is the only good shot, as all the others I took during a full hour shooting are blurred ü§ì
Camera: @sonyalpha a7RII
Tripod: @siruiimaging N-2204SK"
"Archi Love in K√∂ln üá©üá™‚ú®
#takenwithHuawei
[read below the full story behind the shot]
__________________________________________
I had just been back from the US üá∫üá≤; I was facing a pretty huge jet-lag and I didn't have time to get over it, as I had a very tight schedule in K√∂ln. üíº
Tired and sleepy, after a very long day, I still wanted to photograph this amazing architectural complex, which was just a 10-min walk from my apartment.
Once arrived to the shooting location I thought that this would have been the perfect opportunity to test my #huaweip20pro Night Mode üåÜ as I just needed to activate the mode and press the shutter button, something doable even if this tired.
I gave it a try and ""oh boy!üòÆ"", I have been really amazed by the results, as it captured and incredible amount of light over a few seconds, giving me a pretty clean & detailed picture, all without needing a tripod! ü§Ø
‚Ü©Ô∏è
Back in university I graduated in design (industrial design to be specific), and that really opened my mind in terms of understanding that behind each object, even the most simple one, there's so, so much work. 
Some might think that design is that frivolous thing that ""makes things beautiful"", but it's quite the opposite. To design, is to create something that works, that makes life easier to someone, just as making a jet-lagged traveler take night shots with its phone.
Beauty lies within the essence of the function itself.
Awesome work @huaweimobileit ü§ì
[Here's a slice of üçï for you that read the whole caption, I appreciate your time!]"
"Every January is like being presented with a blank canvas: it's all up to us what will get painted on it. üé®
I wish you all to live a meaningful 2019, where you will go for your dream even if it seems far, lost somewhere behind the horizon. üåÖ
__________________________________________
[Looking back at 2018]
It has been a year of transition, learning, and growth.
I've taken my longest trip yet, living 104 days around South East Asia üåè without a fixed base; an experience which I'm looking forward to repeating in the future, and that I recommend you do somewhere along your path. ‚ú®
Living out of a suitcaseüíº, without the ""daily comforts"" that we all give for granted (just like making espresso‚òï whenever I want one), was an incredibly valuable life lesson. üôè
It taught me that I don't really need all the material things that I have, that we as humans have an incredible capacity to adapt, and that we are biased by our own culture more than we might think of.
After all, it taught me that the true essence of traveling is to embrace whatever we encounter like a child would, with no judgment whatsoever, bearing nothing more than curiosity and the desire to learn üåü"

"This summer the @honnoldfoundation supported a project in Detroit with NEWCC (North End Woodward Community Coalition) to put solar on 10 homes. @rubensalgadoescudero came through as part of his solar portraits series to document some of the work, which is where this photo comes from. 
Next month, the Honnold Foundation will be holding an open call for grant applications - basically we‚Äôll be accepting project ideas starting on January 13th. I‚Äôll post more about it as we get closer, but I‚Äôm pretty excited to see what kind of solar work we can help support in the coming year. @insidenatgeo"
"I‚Äôm so sorry to hear that @bradgobright just died in a climbing accident. He was such a warm, kind soul - one of a handful of partners that I always loved spending a day with. I suppose there‚Äôs something to be said about being safe out there and the inherent risks in climbing but I don‚Äôt really care about that right now. I‚Äôm just sad for Brad and his family. And for all of us who were so positively affected by his life. So crushing. Brad was a real gem of a man. For all his strengths and weaknesses (like his insanely strong fingers, or living out of a Honda Civic...) at the core he was just a good guy. 
I guess there‚Äôs nothing really to say. I‚Äôm sad. The climbing world lost a true light. Rest in peace..."
"Yesterday I had the pleasure of climbing the Misty Wall (12 pitch 5.13a) with @sannimccandless (who got this rad belay pic). It‚Äôs a pretty impressive route next to Yosemite Falls first freed by @sashadigiulian,  @jon_cardwell and @mgclimber1 - which I found to be an impressive effort on their part since there‚Äôs so much wide climbing and groveling. Seems like it must have been a super hard style for folks who don‚Äôt climb in Yosemite much. 
Lovely outing in a lovely place - slowly winding down the Yosemite season..."
Had a ton of fun forerunning and enjoying the new problems at Planet Granite Fountain Valley this morning. Seeing these gyms come together makes me stoked to be a part of the Planet Granite family. If you live in the area, sign up for updates or get your membership at planetgranite.com
"This is a photo of @tommycaldwell looking calm and collected while sending a 5.13c (8a+) corner pitch on the third night of our recent new route on El Cap. I included a pic of me looking incredibly gripped while trying to clip a bolt from our first night on the wall for contrast. 
I‚Äôve always known that Tommy was an incredible big wall climber; I grew up watching films about his feats. And we‚Äôve had enough big adventures over the years that I‚Äôve gotten to see some of his best performances first hand (Fitz Traverse, or the Free Triple...). But spending 4 days with him on El Cap really highlighted the fact that he‚Äôs maybe the best big wall climber in the world. On nights 2 and 3 he spent several hours after dark to work and then send a 13d and 13c pitch. Both pitches were freakin hard with slightly finicky gear but he just worked it all out and executed perfectly. Both nights I got too cold and too scared and opted to wait until morning and climb them in the light. After 7 years of working on the Dawn Wall Tommy is truly an incredible night climber. I‚Äôd say it was a sight to behold, except that I couldn‚Äôt see anything - I just fed out rope while he sent through the night. 
Anyway, it was inspiring to see Tommy‚Äôs level of skill and effort up there. And it‚Äôs the kind of thing that often goes unrecognized behind ‚Äúthey climbed a new route‚Äù. But how he climbed it was remarkable. 
Thanks @austin_siadak for the great photos and keeping us company through the long nights..."
I had the pleasure of supporting @emilyaharrington on an in-a-day attempt on Golden Gate (30+ pitch 13a) yesterday. It was pretty inspiring to see her try her best and fight her way up to the last hard pitch. No send, but a lot of learning and character building, which is kind of all we‚Äôre after in wall climbing...
@tommycaldwell just posted about our recent journey up El Cap so I figured I‚Äôd join in. We climbed a new free line that follows @leo_houlding‚Äôs old route Passage to Freedom and continues 20 more pitches to the top. Incredible 5.13+ corners up high. @austin_siadak spent 4 days on the wall with us documenting and helping with all the bigwall toil. An incredible experience which reminded me that Tommy really is the best big wall climber in the world and that I still have a lot to learn. Nothing like El Cap to humble you...
"A rare live update from the side of El Cap. @austin_siadak toiling away on fixed lines while @tommycaldwell and I try to get psyched to put climbing shoes back on... still a long way to the top...
@austin_siadak happens to be a very talented, and very single, photographer/videographer. In case anyone needs some big wall filming. Or a major wall hunk in their life..."
I‚Äôve been playing around up on El Cap with @tommycaldwell, @kjorgeson and @austin_siadak recently. This is Tommy styling one of many 5.13 corners, though this one was originally freed by @leo_houlding 20 years ago. Good times back on the wall...
@carlodenali looking pretty relaxed on 5.13. Turns out that when you can boulder V15 climbing sport routes is really darn easy.

"LE PREGUNTE A MI MADRE COMO  SE PIERDE LA VIDA ?

La vida se pierde de muchas formas hijo.
Se pierde cuando quieres vivir la vida de otros y no la tuya.
Se pierde criticando los errores de otros, y no mejorando los tuyos. 
Se pierde cuando te lamentas a cada momento por haber fracasado y no buscar soluciones para poder triunfar.
Se pierde , cuando te la pasas envidiando a los dem√°s , y no super√°ndote a ti mismo .
Se pierde cuando te enfocas en cosas negativas  y dejas de disfrutas las cosas buenas .
LA VIDA NO SE PIERDE CUANDO DEJAS DE RESPIRAR ,
SINO CUANDO DEJAS DE SER FELIZ ..."

Lazy days on the Oregon Coast. I spent most of my life inland, preferably around big rocky things but every few months I crave seeing the ocean for a few days. Here‚Äôs a slice from one of our latest trips in the PNW..
Cold days out West. Working with @CanonUSA to put the EOS 1DX Mark II through the paces while shooting a Fjallr√§ven story a few months back. These kind of projects are my favorite because of how demanding they are; freezing temps and on the move from sunrise to sunset with an awesome crew. #CoCreateWithCanon
Happy to be helping @polarpro launch their new Summit Series Filters.. Took them on an early fall field trip in the mountains around home to see what the fuss was all about. Even made a film for them about what it means to be an adventure photographer. Link in profile If you‚Äôre curious, I‚Äôve never spent so much time writing and re-writing a film ‚úåüèª
We came to South Greenland in part to sail among Icebergs. This is one of the most remarkable ones we saw on our trip. For a moment we thought about driving the boat through the arch to get a closer look at it but the captain quickly deterred us from it from fears of it collapsing on us.. What a beast
The Greenland ice sheet. This is a panorama of 12 horizontal photos, just to give you a sense of the scale of this place. Just a few years ago, the ice fell into the water but in you can see that it is retracting over the rock now and will continue to do until its no longer visible from the sea. Powerful seeing our changing climate first hand..
Finally got around editing one of my favourite photos from the Greenland trip. This is Sebastien, our rad skipper from France on the @auroraarktika, taking the crew back to the boat..
Light in the valley

december always feels like an appropriate time to reflect. it's of course the end of the year, but also my birthday month, so it's the end of "another" year for me, too. more than ever, i feel incredibly lucky to live in this crazy city, work on projects that are creatively challenging and fulfilling, and most importantly, be healthy enough to work out and run around. [#ad] i'm excited to be partnering with @olivela on their $1 million dollar pledge this holiday season. if you are also feeling lucky and grateful for what you have in your life, i hope you'll take a minute out of your day to sign up your email on http://olivela.com. for every email sign-up, olivela will donate $5 (they‚Äôve upped it to $10 on this giving tuesday! and you can choose which of the four charities they're supporting to put your money toward). it's super low effort on your part and can make the biggest difference. thank you so much.

"–°–ø—Ä–∞—à–∏–≤–∞—é –≤—á–µ—Ä–∞ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –¥–µ–≤—á–æ–Ω–æ–∫, —á—Ç–æ –∏–º –∏–∑ –ö–∏–µ–≤–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ–∑—Ç–∏. –ê–ª—å–º–∏—Ä–∞: ¬´–ú–∞–º, –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ–∑–∏ —á–∏–ø—Å—ã!¬ªüòÅ. –ü–æ-–º–æ–µ–º—É, –¥–ª—è –Ω–µ–µ –æ—Ç—ä–µ–∑–¥ –º–∞–º—ã - —ç—Ç–æ –∫–∞–∫ –º–∞–º–∞ –ø–æ—à–ª–∞ –≤ –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω, –∞ –Ω–µ –≤ –¥—Ä—É–≥—É—é —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Éüôà.
‚†Ä

‚†Ä
–ó–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞ —É –º–µ–Ω—è —Å—ä–µ–º–∫–∏ –≤ —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–µ, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –≥—É–ª—è—Ç—å —Å –ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–≥–∞–º–∏, –∞ 10 –¥–µ–∫–∞–±—Ä—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å (–≤—Å—é –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∞ –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å, –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—Ç—å!). 11-–≥–æ —á–∏—Å–ª–∞ —Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞ —Å—ä–µ–º–∫–∏, –∞ 12-–≥–æ –ø–æ–ª–µ—á—É –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ –∫ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º –º–∞–ª—ã—à–∫–∞–º —Ç–∏—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å –∏—Ö –¥–æ —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ –†–æ–∂–¥–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ü•∞.
‚†Ä

"–í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å –Ω–∞ –∑–∞—Å—ã–ø–∫—É: –≤—ã –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ —Å –¥–µ—Ç—å–º–∏ –≤ –∞–∫–≤–∞–ø–∞—Ä–∫, —Å–∞–º–∏-—Ç–æ —Å –≥–æ—Ä–æ–∫ –∫–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç–µ—Å—å?
‚†Ä

‚†Ä

‚†Ä
–í –∫–∞—Ñ–µ –∫–æ—Ä–º—è—Ç –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω–æ, —Ü–µ–Ω—ã –≤–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ –≥—É–º–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è –Ω–∞ —Å—É—à–∫–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–∂–Ω–µ–π—à–∏–π –∫—É—Ä–∏–Ω—ã–π —à–∞—à–ª—ã–∫, –æ—Ç–¥–∞–ª–∞ —è –∑–∞ –Ω–µ–≥–æ, –∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç—Å—è, —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π 200üòÄ. –¢–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ —è –æ—Ç–¥–∞–ª–∞, —Ç.–∫.–Ω–µ —è –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∞. –ö–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ, –≤—ã –ø–æ–Ω—è–ª–∏, —Ç–∞–º –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–æ–±–µ–¥–∞—Ç—å.
‚†Ä
–ï–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ, –±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å —Å–æ–±–æ–π —à–ª–µ–ø–∫–∏, –æ—Ç –Ω–∞–ø–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏—è –∫ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü—É –¥–Ω—è –±–æ–ª—è—Çüò≠.
‚†Ä
–ö—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏, –º–æ–∏—Ö –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∂–¥–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–∞—è —Å–∫–∏–¥–æ—á–∫–∞ –ø–æ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–µ –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å, –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤–æ—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–π—Ç–µ—Å—å! –†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é –æ—Ç –¥—É—à–∏üëå.
‚†Ä
–ò–Ω—Å—Ç–∞–≥—Ä–∞–º –∞–∫–≤–∞–ø–∞—Ä–∫–∞ @karibiya, –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –æ–Ω –≤ –ü–µ—Ä–æ–≤–æ."
"–ñ–†–Å–¢–ï??? –Ø –¢–û–ñ–ï!!!
‚†Ä
–ó–ê–ñ–û–† –ü–û–°–õ–ï –°–û–†–ï–í–ù–û–í–ê–ù–ò–ô - —è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ª—é–±–æ–π –¥–∏–µ—Ç—ã. –ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á–µ–º –¥–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤—ã —Å–∏–¥–µ–ª–∏ –±–µ–∑ —É–≥–ª–µ–≤–æ–¥–æ–≤, —Ç–µ–º –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤–∞–º –≥—Ä–æ–∑—è—Ç –æ—Ç–µ–∫–∏, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —É–≥–ª–∏ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—Å—è‚òùüèº.
‚†Ä
–í–µ–¥—å 1–≥ —É–≥–ª–µ–≤–æ–¥–æ–≤ —Å–≤—è–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç 4–≥ –≤–æ–¥—ãüò±. –≠—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –∏ –Ω–µ –ø–ª–æ—Ö–æ, —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –§–ê–ö–¢.
‚†Ä
–ù—É –∞ –ø–æ–µ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–æ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π - –¥–µ–ª–æ —Å–≤—è—Ç–æ–µ‚òùüèº. –ù–µ –∑–Ω–∞—é, –∫–∞–∫ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ, –∞ —è –¥–∞–ª–∞ —Å–µ–±–µ –ß–ï–¢–´–†–ï –î–ù–Ø –Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö –∏ –æ—Ç —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º–∞, –∏ –æ—Ç —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∫. –ú–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –±—ã–ª–æ –Ω–µ –¥–æ–π—Ç–∏ –¥–æ –∑–∞–ª–∞ —Å –Ω–µ–∑–∞–ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º –ø–µ—Ä–µ–ª–µ—Ç–æ–º/–ø–µ—Ä–µ–µ–∑–¥–æ–º, –∏ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å —Ö–∞—á–∞–ø—É—Ä–∏ –∏ –±—É–ª–æ—á–µ–∫ —Å –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Ü–µ–πü•êüßÄ. –Ø –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∞ —Å–µ–±—è –±–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ —Ä—É–∫–∞–ºü§≠. –ù–æ –≤–æ—Ç –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è —è —É–≤–∏–¥–µ–ª–∞ —Å–≤–æ–∏ –æ—Ç–µ–∫—à–∏–µ –Ω–æ–≥–∏, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –æ—Ç–ø–µ—á–∞—Ç–∞–ª–∏—Å—å —Ä–µ–∑–∏–Ω–∫–∏ –æ—Ç –Ω–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤ –∏ —â–µ–∫–∏, –Ω–µ –ø–æ–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏–≤—à–∏–µ—Å—è –≤ –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤ (–ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç, –≤–∏–Ω–∏—à–∫–æüëãüèª), —Ç–æ –≤–∑—è–ª–∞ –Ω–æ–≥–∏ –≤ —Ä—É–∫–∏ –∏ –ø–æ—à–ª–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫—É. –ù–µ—Ç, –Ω–µ –ø–æ—à–ª–∞, –ü–û–ë–ï–ñ–ê–õ–ê –≤–æ–ª–æ—Å—ã –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥! –û—Ç—Ö–µ—Ä–∞—á–∏–ª–∞ —Ç–∞–º –∫–∞—Ä–¥–∏–æ, –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–∞—Å—å –ø–æ –ª–∞–π—Ç—É –ø–æ –≤–µ—Ä—Ö—É –∏ –°–†–ê–ó–£ –ø–æ—á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ —Å–µ–±—è –ª—É—á—à–µ.
‚†Ä
–ó–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —É –≤–∞—Å –±—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–∏–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–π–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤—Å–µ –≤–∞–ª–∏—Ç—Å—è –∏–∑ —Ä—É–∫, –Ω–µ—Ä–≤—ã –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ –∏ —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—è –ª–∏–±–æ –∑–∞—Ä—ã—Ç—å—Å—è –ø–æ–¥ –∑–µ–º–ª—é, –ª–∏–±–æ –ø–∏—Ä–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∫—É, –≤—ã–±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –ø–∏—Ä–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∫—ÉüßÅ, —Å—ä–µ—à—å—Ç–µ –µ–µ —Å–æ —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π —Å–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç—å—é, –∞ –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≥–ª—é–∫–æ–∑–∞ –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–µ—Ç –≤ –º–æ–∑–≥, —Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—Ç—å –≤—ã—Ç–∏—Ä–∞—Ç—å —Å–ª–µ–∑—ã-—Å–æ–ø–ª–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å –≤–∞—à–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã. –ù—É –∏–ª–∏ –Ω–∞ –∫—Ä–∞–π–Ω—è–∫ –ø—Ä–∏—Å–µ–¥–∞—Ç—å, —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—ã –Ω–µ —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç, –Ω–æ –Ω–∞–∫–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∑–∞–¥–Ω–∏—Ü–∞ –ª–∏—à–Ω–µ–π –Ω–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Çüëå.
‚†Ä
–í –æ–±—â–µ–º, —è –≤–æ—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Å–∞—é –∏–∑ –º–µ—Ä—Ç–≤—ã—Ö, —Ä–∞–¥—É—é –≤–∞—Å –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–º–∏ –ª–∞–π—Ñ—Ö–∞–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å, –≤ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∞—Ö –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–∂—É –Ω–∞ —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º. –£ –º–µ–Ω—è 10 –¥–µ–∫–∞–±—Ä—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–æ—Ç—ã –≤ –ö–∏–µ–≤–µ, —Å—É—Ö–æ–π –±—ã—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è (—Ç–∞–º –∂—é—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç), –Ω–∞–¥–æ —á—É—Ç–∫–∞ –ø–æ–¥–∑–∞–ø–ª—ã—Ç—å –∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –∂–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑üòç. –í—Å—è –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å—É - –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å, –≤—Ö–æ–¥ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π, –Ω–æ –ø–æ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–∞–º, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –∑–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µüíã."
"–î–∞, –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∏–µ –º–æ–∏, —è –ø—Å–∏—Ö–∞–Ω—É–ª–∞ –∏ —É–ª–µ—Ç–µ–ª–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–∏ –¥–Ω—è –∫ –¥–µ—Ç—è–º. –õ–µ–∂–∞ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–ª—É –≤ –≥—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–∫–µ –∏ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞—è —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª–∞, —è –≤–¥—Ä—É–≥ –æ—â—É—Ç–∏–ª–∞ –Ω–µ–≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω—É—é –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –º–µ–Ω—è –æ–±–Ω—è–ª–∏ –∏ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ –ª—é–±—è—Ç. –ß—Ç–æ —è –Ω—É–∂–Ω–∞, —á—Ç–æ –º–µ–Ω—è –∂–¥–∞–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ –º–Ω–µ —Ä–∞–¥—ã!!!!
‚†Ä
–Ø –æ—Ç–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª–∞ –≤—Å–µ —Å—ä–µ–º–∫–∏ –∏ –≤—Å–µ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∏ –∏ —Å–ø–æ–Ω—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω–æ –∫—É–ø–∏–ª–∞ –±–∏–ª–µ—Ç—ã –≤ –ì–∞–º–±—É—Ä–≥. –°–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –Ø –ë–û–õ–¨–®–ï –ù–ï –ú–û–ì–£.
‚†Ä
–ö–∞–∫ –∂–µ —è –Ω–µ —Ö–æ—á—É —Ä–∞–∑–ª—É—á–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å –º–∞–ª—ã—à–∫–∞–º–∏, –Ω–æ, –≤–æ-–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã—Ö, —è –Ω–µ –≤ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–∏ –∂–∏—Ç—å –≤ –ì–µ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–∏–∏, –∞ –≤–æ-–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö, —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ –º–æ–µ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–µ.
‚†Ä
–õ–∞–¥–Ω–æ, —ç—Ç–æ –≤—Å–µ –ª–∏—Ä–∏–∫–∞. –Ø –≤ –æ–±—â–µ–º-—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞—é —Å–µ–±—è –ø–ª–æ—Ö–æ–π –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä—å—é, —è –∏ –æ–¥–µ–≤–∞—é –∏—Ö, –∏ –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–æ –æ–±–æ–≥–∞—â–∞—é, –∏ –≤ –æ—Ç–ø—É—Å–∫–∞ –≤–æ–∂—É, –∏ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏–º –º—ã –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ, –ê–ª—å–º–∏—Ä–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª—é–±–∏—Ç –ø–µ—á—å, —è –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å –µ–µ –±–ª–∏–Ω—ã –∏ –≤–∞—Ñ–ª–∏. –ù–∞ –†–æ–∂–¥–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —è —É–∂–µ –Ω–∞–∫—É–ø–∏–ª–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ—á–µ–∫ –∏ —É–∫—Ä–∞—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–µ–∫üòç. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –º–æ–µ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–∞ –≤ –ö–∏–µ–≤–µ –Ω–∞—á–Ω–µ–º –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —É–∫—Ä–∞—à–∞—Ç—å –¥–æ–º, –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–º –µ–ª–∫—É...–í—Å–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —è –¥–æ–º–∞, —è –∑–∞–±–∏–≤–∞—é –Ω–∞ 60% —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –∏ –æ—Ç–¥–∞—é –µ–≥–æ –¥–µ–≤–æ—á–∫–∞–º. –í–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ, —è –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∂—É —Å –Ω–∏–º–∏ –º–∞–ª–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∏—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∫, –Ω–æ —Ç–∞–∫ –ª–∏ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç –ö–ê–ß–ï–°–¢–í–û?
‚†Ä
–í–æ–æ–±—â–µ, —á—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç - –•–û–†–û–®–ê–Ø –ú–ê–ú–ê? –¢–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –Ω–∞—Å–µ–¥–∫–æ–π —Å–∏–¥–∏—Ç –¥–æ–º–∞, —Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –Ω–∞ –¥–µ—Ç—Å–∫—É—é –ø–ª–æ—â–∞–¥–∫—É –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–ø–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å –ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–∂–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏–ª–∏ 24/7 —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –¥–µ—Ç–µ–π –ø–æ –ú–æ–Ω—Ç–µ—Å—Å–æ—Ä–∏? –¢–∞–∫ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç, —è –≤—Å–µ-—Ç–∞–∫–∏ –ø–ª–æ—Ö–∞—è –º–∞—Ç—å? –Ø –∂–µ –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞—éü§î."
"–°–æ—Ä—Ä–∏ –∑–∞ –º–æ–∏ —Å–ª–µ–∑—ã –∏ —Å–æ–ø–ª–∏ –≤ —ç—Ñ–∏—Ä–µ. –£–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥–ª–∞ –¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—Ç—å –≤ —Å–µ–±–µ.—Å–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ, —á—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–∏ —Å–æ –º–Ω–æ–π, –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞ –º–Ω–µ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –Ω–µ–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–∞üòî.
‚†Ä
–ó–∞—Ç–æ —É–∂–∏–Ω –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª—Å—è —Ñ–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—á–∫–∏–º! –ê –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ - –∏–∑ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤. –î–ª—è —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç–∞ —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ —ç—Ñ–∏—Ä - –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–∞—è –∏–¥–µ—è –¥–ª—è –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ–¥–Ω–µ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∞. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç —Å—é–¥–∞ - –Ω–∞–º–µ–∫–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –≤ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏—è—Ö, —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å —è —ç—Ç–æ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å —Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –≤ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–∏ - –≤–æ –º–Ω–µ –±—É—Ç—ã–ª–∫–∞ –≤–∏–Ω–∞ü§™.
‚†Ä
–ò—Ç–∞–∫, –Ω–∞—à —É–∂–∏–Ω —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–ª –∏–∑ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö —á–∞—Å—Ç–µ–π:
‚†Ä
–£—Ç–∏–Ω–∞—è –≥—Ä—É–¥–∫–∞: —Å–æ–ª–∏–º, –ø–æ—Å—ã–ø–∞–µ–º –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Ü–µ–π, —É–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞–µ–º —Å–≤–µ–∂–∏–π –æ—Ä–µ–≥–∞–Ω–æ –∏ –ø–∞—Ä—É —Ç–æ–ª—á–µ–Ω—ã—Ö –∑—É–±—á–∏–∫–æ–≤ —á–µ—Å–Ω–æ–∫–∞. –°—Ç–∞–≤–∏–º –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Ç—É—é –¥–æ 220 –≥—Ä –¥—É—Ö–æ–≤–∫—É –Ω–∞ 25 –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç, –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º —Å–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º —Ç–µ–º–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç—É—Ä—É –¥–æ 180 –∏ –ø–æ–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ–º —É—Ç–∫—É —Å–æ–∫–æ–º –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω—ã –∞–ø–µ–ª—å—Å–∏–Ω–∞, —Å–º–µ—à–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Å 1 —á.–ª.–º–µ–¥–∞.
‚†Ä
–ú–µ–ª–∫–∏–π –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–æ—Ñ–µ–ª—å, –±–∞—Ç–∞—Ç, —Ç—ã–∫–≤—É –ø—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∞—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –æ—Ç–≤–∞—Ä–∏–≤–∞–µ–º –¥–æ –ø–æ–ª—É–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞–µ–º –≤ –±–ª—é–¥–æ –¥–ª—è –∑–∞–ø–µ–∫–∞–Ω–∏—è, –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º –ø–æ–º–∏–¥–æ—Ä–∫–∏ —á–µ—Ä—Ä–∏, –∏–Ω–∂–∏—Ä, –∫—É—Ä–∞–≥—É –∏ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∏–∫–∏ (—Å—É—Ö–æ—Ñ—Ä—É–∫—Ç—ã –ª—É—á—à–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∞—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–º–æ—á–∏—Ç—å). –ú–∞—Å—Å–∞ –æ–≤–æ—â–µ–π –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ 2 –∫–≥.
‚†Ä
–ü–æ—Å—ã–ø–∞–µ–º –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–∏–º—Å—è –æ—Ç –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–∫–∏ —á–µ—Å–Ω–æ–∫–æ–º (6-7 –∏–∑–º–µ–ª—å—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∑—É–±—á–∏–∫–æ–≤) –∏ –æ—Ä–µ–≥–∞–Ω–æ, —Å–æ–ª–∏–º, –ø–µ—Ä—á–∏–º, –ø–æ–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ–º —Å–æ–∫–æ–º –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—à–µ–π—Å—è –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω—ã –∞–ø–µ–ª—å—Å–∏–Ω–∞, –ø–æ—Å—ã–ø–∞–µ–º –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Ü–µ–π –∏ –º—É—Å–∫–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–º –æ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–º, –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º 2 —Å—Ç.–ª.–æ–ª–∏–≤–∫–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–∞—Å–ª–∞. –°—Ç–∞–≤–∏–º –≤ –¥—É—Ö–æ–≤–∫—É –∫ —É—Ç–∫–µ.
‚†Ä
–ë–µ—Ä–µ–º –±—É–ª–æ—á–∫—É, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ–∑–∞–µ–º –µ–µ –ø–æ–ø–æ–ª–∞–º, –æ–±–∂–∞—Ä–∏–≤–∞–µ–º —Å –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –æ–ª–∏–≤–∫–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–∞—Å–ª–∞ —Å –¥–≤—É—Ö —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω. –ù–∞ –æ–¥–Ω—É —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—É –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–ª–∏–≤–∫–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –º–∞—Å–ª–∞, —Å–º–µ—à–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å –º–µ–¥–æ–º –∏ —Å–æ–∫–æ–º –∞–ø–µ–ª—å—Å–∏–Ω–∞ (–Ω—É–∂–Ω–∞ –±—É–∫–≤–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –∫–∞–ø–ª—è –¥–ª—è –∑–∞–ø–∞—Ö–∞), –≤—ã–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞–µ–º –∏–∑–º–µ–ª—å—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ–º–∏–¥–æ—Ä–∫–∏ —á–µ—Ä—Ä–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—ã–ø–∞–µ–º —á–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–º –ø–µ—Ä—Ü–µ–º.
‚†Ä
–ü—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã–π —É–∂–∏–Ω –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤, –∑–∞–±–∏—Ä–∞–π—Ç–µ –≤ –∑–∞–∫–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏!
‚†Ä
#–∞–ª–∏–æ–Ω–∞_—Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç—ã"
"–°–æ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω!üèÜ
‚†Ä
–ü–æ–º–Ω–∏—Ç–µ, —è –≤–∞–º –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–æ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ —Ç–æ–π –µ–¥—ã, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è.üëå, –Ω–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—è?üòâ
–ù–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω—é: –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å —è –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–ª–∞ –Ω–∞ –ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–∫–µ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º–Ω–µ —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å, –Ω–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω–∞ —è —Å–æ —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π —Å–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç—å—é –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏–ª–∞ —Å–µ–±–µ –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω—è—à–∫–∏ –ø–æ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫—É. –ö—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏, –∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ–π –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥! –ë–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–æ—á–∫—É üëå.
‚†Ä
–¢–µ–º –±–æ–ª–µ–µ, –≤ –ª—é–±–∏–º–æ–º –ß–∏–ª–ª–∞—É—Ç–µ @collectsiya_food_chillout –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ –±–ª—é–¥–æ ¬´–ú–æ—Ä—Å–∫–∞—è –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ü–∏—è Double¬ª, –∞ –ø–æ —Å—É–±–±–æ—Ç–∞–º –∫—Ä–µ–≤–µ—Ç–∫–∏ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏ –µ—â—ë –¥–µ—à–µ–≤–ª–µ: 470‚ÇΩ –∑–∞ –∫–≥, –∞ –ª–∞–Ω–≥—É—Å—Ç–∏–Ω—ã 600‚ÇΩ –∑–∞ –∫–≥. –≠—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–∏–∫ –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ!üòç
‚†Ä
–î–µ–≤—á–æ–Ω–∫–∏, —Ö–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –ø–æ–ª–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–∞–º—ã–º–∏ –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω—ã–º–∏ –º–æ—Ä–µ–ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏ –∏ –º—è—Å–æ–º –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–µ? üòã
‚†Ä
–ü–æ–¥–ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –Ω–∞ –∞–∫–∫–∞—É–Ω—Ç @collectsiya_food_chillout, –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ ‚ù§Ô∏è –∏ –ª—é–±–æ–π –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–π –∫ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ø–æ—Å—Ç—É.
–°—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏–≤—à–∏—Ö —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è —è —Ä–∞–∑—ã–≥—Ä–∞—é —Å–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ç –Ω–∞ —É–∂–∏–Ω –Ω–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–ª–æ–º 5000‚ÇΩ üéÅ"
"–ù–µ, –¥–µ–≤—á–æ–Ω–∫–∏, –º–Ω–µ –≤—Å—ë –Ω–∏–∫–∞–∫ –Ω–µ —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç—å—Å—è! –ü–æ–ª–Ω–æ –ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–∂–µ–∫ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª–∏ —Å–µ–±–µ –±—Ä–µ–∫–µ—Ç—ã, –Ω–æ —è —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä—é –Ω–∞ –∏—Ö –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –º—É–∫–∏ –∞–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –µ–¥—ã –∏ —á–∏—Å—Ç–∫–∏, –∏ –º–Ω–µ —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º –Ω–µ —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—è! –¢–µ–º –±–æ–ª–µ–µ, —Å —ç—Å—Ç–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —Ç–æ—á–∫–∏ –∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è —É –º–µ–Ω—è –≤—Å–µüëå. –ù—É –æ–∫, –ø–æ—à–ª–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ—â–∏–Ω—ã –Ω–∞ —ç–º–∞–ª–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–ª—Å—è –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∑—É–±, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ –∫—Ä–∏–º–∏–Ω–∞–ª –≤–µ–¥—å!
‚†Ä
–•–æ—Ç—è –æ—Ä—Ç–æ–¥–æ–Ω—Ç —É—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫ –∂–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è, –≤—Å–µ –Ω–∞–¥–æ –ª–µ—á–∏—Ç—å. –ï—â–µ –±—Ä–µ–∫–µ—Ç—ã, –Ω–∞ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç–æ—á–∫—É, —Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç 190 000‚ÇΩ, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —è —Ä–µ—à—É—Å—å, —Ç–æ –ø–æ–π–¥—É —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∫ @doctor_mun, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ —É –Ω–µ–≥–æ –ª–µ—á–∞—Ç—Å—è –≤—Å–µ –º–æ–∏ –ø–æ–¥—Ä—É–≥–∏, –∏ —è –≤–∏–∂—É —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã...–Ω–æ –±–ª–∏–Ω...—Å–∞–º–∞ —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É!!!
‚†Ä
–ö—Ä–æ—à–∫–∏, —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∂–∏—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–æ —Å–≤–æ–∏ –±—Ä–µ–∫–µ—Ç—ã, —á—Ç–æ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ, –ø—Ä—è–º –≤—Å–µ-–≤—Å–µ-–≤—Å–µ –±–µ–∑ –ø—Ä–∏–∫—Ä–∞—Å!!! –ë—É–¥—É –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–Ω–∞ –∑–∞ –ª—é–±–æ–µ –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ!!!üôèüèº
‚†Ä
–ü–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ, –∫–∞–∫ –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥–∏—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å –∏–∑–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å. –°–ø–µ—Ü–æ–º –¥–ª—è –≤–∞—Å –≤—ã–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª–∞!!! –¢–∞–∫ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ!!!üò≤"
"–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ, –∫—Ä–æ—à–∫–∏ ‚òÄ
‚†Ä
–ö–∞–∫ –≤–∞–º –∂–∏–≤–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–æ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π —Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–æ–π ¬´–≤–Ω–µ —Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω–∞¬ª?
‚†Ä
–≠—Ç–æ—Ç –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å –º–Ω–µ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –∑–∞–¥–∞–≤–∞–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–æ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π! –í–µ–¥—å –Ω–∏ –¥–ª—è –∫–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –∫—Ä—É–≥–ª—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ –±—ã—Ç—å —ç–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å—É—Ö–æ–π –Ω–µ–≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ‚ùå. –î–∞ –∏ –Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ! –ú–æ–∂–µ—Ç, —ç—Ç–æ –∏ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–æ –≤ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç–∞–≥—Ä–∞–º–µ, –Ω–æ –≤ –æ–±—ã—á–Ω–æ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –º–Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫ –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥–µ—Ç—å –Ω–µ —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—èü§™.
‚†Ä
–ü—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞ –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ —è –Ω–∞—Å–ª–∞–∂–¥–∞—é—Å—å —Å–≤–æ–∏–º ¬´–º–µ–∂—Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω—å–µ–º¬ª –ø–æ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ–π, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π —Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–æ–π –≤ —ç—Ç–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—èüëå. –û–Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –º—è–≥–∫–æ–π –∏ –∂–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π, –Ω—É –∏ —è –Ω–µ –∫–æ—Ä–æ–≤–µ—é, –¥–µ—Ä–∂—É —Å–µ–±—è –≤ —Ä—É–∫–∞—Ö!
‚†Ä
–ü–æ—á–µ–º—É —è –ª—é–±–ª—é –º–µ–∂—Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω—å–µ?
‚†Ä
‚úî–£ –º–µ–Ω—è –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å–∏–ª—ã –∏ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—è –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∫;
‚úî–Ø —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É—é —Å–µ–±—è —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–π;
‚úî–Ø —Å–ª—É—à–∞—é —Å–≤–æ–µ —Ç–µ–ª–æ –∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä—É—é—Å—å —Ç–∞–∫, –∫–∞–∫ –º–Ω–µ –Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è (–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å, –∫—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏, –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –æ—Ç–º–µ–Ω—è–ª‚òùüèº);
‚úî–Ø –º–æ–≥—É —Å–µ–±–µ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç—å –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ, –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω—ã–π —Ç–æ—Ä—Ç–∏–∫üòú;
‚úî–Ø —É–ª—É—á—à–∞—é —Å–≤–æ—é –±–∞–∑—Éüî•, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π —Ä–∞–∑ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å –µ—â–µ –ª—É—á—à–µ;
‚úî–Ø –Ω–∞—Å–ª–∞–∂–¥–∞—é—Å—å –µ–¥–æ–π (—Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ –±—ã—Ç—å);
‚úî–û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è —è –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—é—Å—å –≥–∏–±–∫–æ–π –¥–∏–µ—Ç—ã, –≤–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞—è –≤ —Å–≤–æ–π —Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º–Ω–µ –Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è.
‚†Ä
–î–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–≤?
‚†Ä
–ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–∞ —è –ø–æ–¥–Ω—è–ª–∞ —Å–≤–æ–π –∫–∞–ª–æ—Ä–∞–∂ –¥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤–µ—Å–∞ –∏ –∫–∞–∂–¥—É—é –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª—é –¥–µ–ª–∞—é —Å–≤–æ–π —Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω –≤—Å–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –≥–∏–±–∫–∏–º. –ü–µ—Ä–≤–æ–µ –¥–≤–µ –Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–æ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π —è, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ, –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø—Ä–µ–≤—ã—à–∞—é –ª–∏–º–∏—Ç - –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º—É –Ω—É–∂–Ω—ã —Å–∏–ª—ã –Ω–∞ –≤–æ—Å—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ (–∏ –º–æ–∑–≥—É —Ç–æ–∂–µüòú). –ü–æ—Ç–æ–º –≤—Å–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –∫ –Ω—É–∂–Ω—ã–º –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è–º.
‚†Ä
–Ø –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ –º–Ω–µ –ø–∏—à–µ—Ç ¬´–æ–π, —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–ª–æ—Ä–∏–∏ - –Ω–µ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è, —ç—Ç–æ —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º –∑–∞–ø–∞—Ä–Ω–æ). –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É? –ü–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ —Å–∞–º–∞ –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞-—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–πüôãüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄ. –£ –º–µ–Ω—è —É—à–ª–æ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ª–µ—Ç, –ø—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ —á–µ–º —è —Å–º–æ–≥–ª–∞ –Ω–∞—á–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç—Å–ª–µ–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–ª–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏–ª–∏ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—É—é –ø—Ä–∏–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∫ –Ω–∏–º. –ù–æ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–º–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –ª—É—á—à–∏–º, —á—Ç–æ —è –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞-–ª–∏–±–æ –¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∞.
‚†Ä
–ü–û–ß–ï–ú–£?
‚†Ä
‚úî–í—ã –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç–µ –∏ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç–µ, –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É –≤—ã —Ç–µ—Ä—è–µ—Ç–µ –∏–ª–∏ –Ω–∞–±–∏—Ä–∞–µ—Ç–µ –≤–µ—Å (—á—Ä–µ–∑–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –∫ –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä—É –≤–µ—Å–∞, –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –∫ –ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ä–µ –≤–µ—Å–∞, —É–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤–µ—Å–∞ ‚Äì –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –æ–Ω –æ—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ).
‚úî–ö—Ä–æ–º–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —É –≤–∞—Å –µ—Å—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—Ç—å –≤ —Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω –ª—é–±–∏–º—ã–µ –±–ª—é–¥–∞ (–±–µ–∑ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –≤–∏–Ω—ã) –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å –∏ –≤—Å–µ —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã!
‚úî–≠—Ç–æ –¥–∞–µ—Ç –≤–∞–º –≥–∏–±–∫–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –¥–æ–ª–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–µ–∫.
‚†Ä"
"–í—ã –¥—É–º–∞–µ—Ç–µ, —è —Å–æ—à–ª–∞ —Å —É–º–∞? –ë—Ä–æ—Å–∏–ª–∞ –¥–µ—Ç–µ–π –∏ —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å. –¢—É—Å—É—é—Å—å —Ü–µ–ª—ã–º–∏ –¥–Ω—è–º–∏ –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞, –ù–ê–°–õ–ê–ñ–î–ê–Ø–°–¨ –ñ–ò–ó–ù–¨–Æ?
‚†Ä
–°–µ—Ä—å–µ–∑–Ω–æ? –ö–∞–∫ –±—ã –º–Ω–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ—Çü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄ. –ë–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—á—É —Ç—É—Ç, –∫–∞–∫ –∏—â–∞–∫, —Å 6 —É—Ç—Ä–∞ –¥–æ –ø–æ–ª—É–Ω–æ—á–∏ —Ç–∞—Å–∫–∞—é —Å —Å–æ–±–æ–π —Å—É–º–∫–∏ (–∞–≤—Ç–æ —É –º–µ–Ω—è –Ω–µ—Ç, —è –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –±–ª–æ–≥–µ—Ä), —É—Å–ø–µ–≤–∞—é –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–µ, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ –∂–µ –±–µ–∑ –¥–µ—Ç–µ–π –≥–æ—Ä–∞–∑–¥–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ, —á–µ–º —Å –Ω–∏–º–∏...–Ω–æ –∂–∏—Ç—å –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–ª—É–∫–µ –ù–ï–í–´–ù–û–°–ò–ú–û!!!
‚†Ä
–í—ã —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –≤–∏–¥–∏—Ç–µ, –Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ä–æ–π —è –±—É–∫–≤–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤–æ—é –Ω–∞ –õ—É–Ω—É, —Å–∏–∂—É –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–ª—É –∏ –º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —É–º–∏—Ä–∞—é. –ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –≤—ã —Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç–µ, –∞ —á—ë —Ç—ã –≤—Å–µ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–º–µ–Ω—è–µ—à—å? –£–µ–¥—å –∫ –¥–µ—Ç—è–º –∏ –∂–∏–≤–∏ —Ç–∞–º. –£ –ú–ï–ù–Ø –ù–ï –¢–ê–ö –í–°–ï –ü–†–û–°–¢–ûüòî. –ò —è —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–∞—é—Å—å —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—â–∞—Ç—å, –∫–∞–∫ –º–æ–≥—É.
‚†Ä
–ü–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≥–æ –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —è –ø–æ–Ω—è–ª–∞, —á—Ç–æ –º–Ω–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –∏—Ö –æ–±–Ω—è—Ç—å - —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–µ, —á—Ç–æ —É –º–µ–Ω—è –µ—Å—Ç—å! –ò –º–∞–º—É —Ç–æ–∂–µ!
‚†Ä
–ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –∫—É–ø–∏–ª–∞ –±–∏–ª–µ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–∏ –¥–Ω—è –≤ –ë—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —É–≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –∫—Ä–æ—à–µ–∫, –≥–¥–µ –æ–Ω–∏ —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –∂–∏–≤—É—Ç —Å–æ —Å–∞–æ–∏–º –ø–∞–ø–æ–π!
‚†Ä
–ò –ø—Ä–µ–∂–¥–µ —á–µ–º –ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å –≤—Å—è–∫–∏–π –±—Ä–µ–¥ –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–æ,  —á—Ç–æ —è –Ω–∞—Å–ª–∞–∂–¥–∞—é—Å—å –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å—é –≤ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–µ, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –¥–µ—Ç–∏ —á–∞—Ö–Ω—É—Ç –≤ –ì–µ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–∏–∏, –ø–æ–±–æ–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –ë–æ–≥–∞üôèüèº. –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—â–∞—è, –Ω–µ –ø–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞—è —Ä—É–∫ –º–∞–º–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –¥–ª—è –∏—Ö –±—É–¥—É—â–µ–≥–æ, –ù–ï–î–û–°–¢–û–ô–ù–ê —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –µ–µ –≤–µ—á–Ω–æ –∑–∞–∫–∏–¥—ã–≤–∞–ª–∏ —Ç—É—Ö–ª—ã–º–∏ –ø–æ–º–∏–¥–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏‚ùå."

Alert: read until the end.

These days I was complaining a lot about my intense work routine for being too far away from my family, friends and especially my pregnant Wife.

I almost gave up on coming to Africa this year ... That's when fiddling with my cel phone  I found this picture from last year. 
Notice carefully:

He was saying a prayer when @isthisreal restricted the moment when a ray of light cuts through the sky and meets the Baobab, a sacred tree that symbolizes life and carries with it the strength of African resistance.

And what does this mean? For some just coincidence of chance.
For me it was clear the divine message to remain firm in the mission and the struggle for human dignity. Every smile and every transformed life is worth our effort.

God, I am willing to use the blessings and instruments that Have been given me to serve, because that is the true success.

Ubuntu (I am because we are)"

üëáüèº
2 Rounds
‚ñ™Ô∏è30sec SEESAW SQUAT
(Really push through your heels & do this exercises quickly for extra glute activation!)
‚ñ™Ô∏è30sec | each side SIDE PLANK CLAM
‚ñ™Ô∏è30sec | each side SIDE LYING LEG LIFTS
(Point your toe down to activate glute med, and avoid hip flexor over-activation)
.
Enjoy! üôåüèº #bootyworkout #gluteactivation #athomeworkout

"WHOLE BODY BEGINNER WORKOUT üëäüèº Starting out and need an easy to follow, equipment free workout?
This one has a great mix of movements that work your whole body, teach fundamental movement patterns & build strength & coordination üôåüèº
Even warm up is included! üòÉ
üëáüèº
Exercise 1-4
WARM UP CIRCUIT
‚ñ™Ô∏è20 x STANDING BICYCLE
Really try to get knee to elbow to fire up the core!
‚ñ™Ô∏è10 x PLANK KNEE TO ELBOW
Again, get that knee to elbow!
‚ñ™Ô∏è10 x SQUAT REACH
Keep your back straight (squeeze your shoulder blades together!) and sit your bottom down and back, weight in your heels.
‚ñ™Ô∏è10 x PLANK KNEE DROPS
Keep your belly button pulled in and press your forearms into the ground.
‚úñÔ∏è3 Rounds
.
Exercise 5-8
MAIN CIRCUIT
‚ñ™Ô∏è10 x SEESAW SQUAT
Sit your bottom back, weight in your heels. Look up and keep your back straight!
‚ñ™Ô∏è5 x NEGATIVE REP PUSH UPS + FLOW
Go down s l o w l y...tuck your elbows into your rib cage & keep your neck long. Your belly button should be the last thing to touch the ground!
‚ñ™Ô∏è10 x HALF SIT UP + REACH
Keep looking up to the sky to avoid crunching your neck. Do each rep slowly!
‚ñ™Ô∏è20 x LYING HIP LIFTS
Pull your belly button in & lengthen your lower back. Press through your heels to lift.
‚úñÔ∏è3 Rounds
.
Take your time with each exercise. Focus on quality movement rather than speed üëåüèº‚ò∫Ô∏è Enjoy! üòò #beginnerworkout #homeworkout #freshbodyfitmind
ab‚ô•Ô∏èx
.
Music: Running - Nyxen

ÿ®ŸÖÿß ÿßŸÜŸá ŸÉÿßŸÜ #ŸäŸàŸÖ_ÿ±ŸäÿßÿØÿ©_ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿπŸÖÿßŸÑ_ŸÑŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ£ÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ŸäŸàŸÖŸäŸÜ ÿ≠ÿßÿ®Ÿá ÿßŸàÿµŸÑŸÉŸÖ ŸÉŸÑÿßŸÖ ŸÖŸÜ ŸÇŸÑÿ®Ÿä ‚ô•Ô∏è ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿØÿßŸäŸá ÿ±ŸäÿßÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑÿßÿπŸÖÿßŸÑ ŸÖÿßŸáŸà ÿ≤Ÿä ŸÖÿß Ÿäÿ™ÿ≥ŸàŸÇ ŸÑŸáÿß ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÅÿ™ÿ±Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿßÿÆŸäÿ±Ÿá ŸÖÿ∏Ÿáÿ± Ÿàÿßÿ¨ÿ™ŸÖÿßÿπÿßÿ™ Ÿàÿ≥ŸÅÿ± ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿ∂Ÿàÿπ ÿµÿßÿ± Ÿáÿ®Ÿá .. ÿßŸÑÿßÿπŸÖÿßŸÑ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ∫ŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßÿµ ÿßŸÉÿ®ÿ± Ÿàÿßÿµÿπÿ® ŸÖŸÜ ŸÉÿ∞ÿß ÿå ÿßŸàŸÑ ÿ¥Ÿä ÿ≠ÿØÿØŸä ŸáÿØŸÅŸÉ Ÿàÿ∫ÿßŸäÿ™ŸÉ Ÿàÿ±ŸÉÿ≤Ÿä ÿπŸÑŸäŸáÿß Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿØÿßŸä ŸÅŸä ŸÑÿ≠ÿ∏ÿ™Ÿáÿß ŸÑÿß ÿ™ŸÜÿ™ÿ∏ÿ±Ÿä ÿßŸÑŸàŸÇÿ™ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ´ÿßŸÑŸä ŸÑÿßÿßŸÜŸá ŸÖÿßÿ±ÿßÿ≠ Ÿäÿ¨Ÿä ÿå Ÿàÿßÿ∞ÿß ÿ®ÿØŸäÿ™Ÿä Ÿà Ÿàÿßÿ¨Ÿáÿ™ŸÉ ÿµÿπŸàÿ®ÿßÿ™ ŸÉŸÖŸÑŸä ŸàÿÆŸÑŸäŸÉ ÿßŸÇŸàŸâ ŸÖŸÜŸáÿß ÿßŸÑÿßÿπŸÖÿßŸÑ ŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ±Ÿá ŸàŸÅŸäŸáÿß ÿµÿπŸàÿ®ÿßÿ™ Ÿàÿ™ÿ≠ÿØŸäÿßÿ™ ŸÉÿ´Ÿäÿ±Ÿá ŸàÿßŸÑÿßÿµÿπÿ® ÿßŸÜŸáÿß ŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸÖÿ±Ÿá!! ÿ®ÿ≥ ÿ®ŸÜŸÅÿ≥ ÿßŸÑŸàŸÇÿ™ ŸÅŸäŸáÿß ÿ¥ÿπŸàÿ± ÿßŸÑÿßŸÜÿ¨ÿßÿ≤ Ÿàÿ™ÿ≠ŸÇŸäŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿßŸáÿØÿßŸÅ ÿ®ÿ¥ŸÉŸÑ ÿßŸÉÿ®ÿ± ŸÑÿßÿßŸÜŸá ÿ¥ÿ∫ŸÑŸÉ ŸÖŸÜŸÉ ŸàŸÑŸÉ ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è ÿßŸÜÿß ÿØÿßŸäŸÖ ÿßÿ¥ÿ¨ÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸÜÿßÿ™ ÿßÿ∞ÿß ÿπŸÜÿØŸÉ ŸÅŸÉÿ±Ÿá ÿßÿ®ÿØÿßŸä Ÿàÿ¨ÿ±ÿ®Ÿä ŸàŸÑÿß ÿ™ÿÆŸÑŸä ÿÆŸàŸÅŸÉ ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÅÿ¥ŸÑ ŸäŸàŸÇŸÅŸÉ ŸÑÿßÿßŸÜŸÉ ŸÑŸà ŸÖÿßÿ¨ÿ±ÿ®ÿ™Ÿä ŸÖÿßÿ±ÿßÿ≠ ÿ™ÿ™ÿπŸÑŸÖŸä . ÿßÿ®ÿØÿßŸä ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿßŸÖŸÉÿßŸÜŸäÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸä ÿπŸÜÿØŸÉ ŸàŸäŸàŸÖ ÿπŸÜ ŸäŸàŸÖ ÿ±ÿßÿ≠ ÿ™ŸÉÿ®ÿ±Ÿä ÿ®ÿßÿßÿ∞ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá üí™üèº‚ô•Ô∏è

"‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§ó‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•Ä 150‡§µ‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•á ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§∏‡§∞ ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§• ‡§¨‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡•á ‡§≤‡§ø‡§è ‡§á‡§∏ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞ @ndtv ‡§î‡§∞ @dettol.india ‡§Ö‡§™‡§®‡•Ä #BanegaSwasthIndia ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡§ø‡§Æ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§§‡§π‡§§ 12 ‡§ò‡§Ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ #Swasthagraha ‡§ï‡§∞‡•á‡§Ç‡§ó‡•á‡•§#GandhiJayanti

"On Lata ji‚Äôs 90th birthday, my sentiments and my feelings .. with deep regard and respect‡•§‡•§ ‡§≤‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§ó‡•á‡§∂‡§ï‡§∞ ‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡•Ø‡•¶ ‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑ ‡§ó‡§æ‡§Å‡§† ‡§™‡§∞, ‡§Æ‡•á‡§∞‡•á ‡§ï‡•Å‡§õ ‡§∂‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶ ; ‡§ï‡•Å‡§õ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§®‡§æ‡§è‡§Å , ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§π‡§ø‡§§

"Photo by @amivitale. Reteti Elephant Sanctuary keepers take Shaba and Pokot out for one final nature walk in Namunyak Wildlife Conservancy in northern Kenya prior to their re-introduction into the wild. Rescued as young calves, Shaba had been cared for by the dedicated team at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) for three years and Pokot for two before they were ready to return to the wild. The team had grown very close to each of the animals. They spend more time with these elephants than with their own families and deep bonds had formed. This final walk was a way for everyone to say goodbye before the elephants were transferred to nearby Sera Conservancy for their release (along with Mpala who is not in this photo). Shaba, Mpala and Pokot were reintroduced to the wild on Nov. 16. All are doing well. They have successfully reintegrated into one of the nearby wild herds, which is exactly what all had hoped would happen. Their easy integration is a testament to the knowledge and hard work of all the keepers at @r.e.s.c.u.e. @r.e.s.c.u.e is the first ever community owned elephant sanctuary in all of Africa. What‚Äôs happening at Reteti is nothing less than the beginnings of a transformation not only in the way humans relate to wild animals but also how we relate to one another. This oasis where orphans grow up, learning to be wild so that one day they can rejoin their herds, is a story as much about the elephants as it is about all of humanity.

@conservationorg @kenyawildlifeservice @nrt_kenya @sandiegozoo @tusk_org @davematthewsband @thephotosociety @photography.for.good @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @nikonusa @magicalkenya #protectelephants #bekindtoelephants #DontLetThemDisappear #elephants #saveelephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #photojournalism #amivitale #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador"
"Photos by @amivitale. The wondrous Pokot, who has been lovingly cared for by the team at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) for 2 years, has returned to the wild. Pokot arrived at @r.e.s.c.u.e when he was just 6-months-old, a victim of the drought. It took days of intensive care to nurse him back to health. When signs of playfulness began to emerge, they knew they had turned a corner. He quickly became a staff favorite. He's known at the sanctuary as ‚ÄúSangalia‚Äù which means ""lone bull."" He is kind, gentle and calm and can entertain himself endlessly with games of soccer and diving in the mud-bath, absorbed in his own little world.

Pokot was reintroduced into the wild alongside Shaba and Mpala on Nov. 16. The three are doing wonderfully and have even integrated into one of the wild herds in the area. @r.e.s.c.u.e is the first ever community owned and operated elephant sanctuary in all of Africa. Its goal is to care for and rehabilitate orphaned elephant calves back into the wild. These three and their success in quick re-integration is a testament to the team's knowledge, ability and dedication.

@conservationorg @kenyawildlifeservice @nrt_kenya @sandiegozoo @tusk_org @davematthewsband @thephotosociety @photography.for.good @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @nikonusa @magicalkenya #protectelephants #bekindtoelephants #DontLetThemDisappear #elephants #saveelephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #photojournalism #amivitale #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador"
"Photos by @amivitale. Mpala, the most enchanting orphaned elephant who was lovingly cared for at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) for the past two and a half years has finally returned to the wild. Three-year-old Mpala was the rambunctious one. She arrived at @r.e.s.c.u.e when she was 7-months-old, a victim of the drought. She integrated into the herd quickly. Her place was in the middle of it all. If there was a ruckus to be had, she was throwing back her trunk and rumbling in the muck, enjoying a refreshing mud bath. She has been carefully re-introduced into the wild alongside proxy matriarch Shaba and lone-bull Pokot under the guidance of @kenyawildlifeservice. The three are doing wonderfully in the wild and have joined one of the wild herds in the area, which is exactly what we had hoped for.

@conservationorg @kenyawildlifeservice @nrt_kenya @sandiegozoo @tusk_org @davematthewsband @thephotosociety @photography.for.good @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @nikonusa @magicalkenya #protectelephants #bekindtoelephants #DontLetThemDisappear #elephants #saveelephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #photojournalism #amivitale #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador"
"Photos by @amivitale. Beloved orphan elephant Shaba who has been lovingly cared for at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e) for the past three years has returned to the wild. To say she will be missed is an understatement. Shaba arrived at @r.e.s.c.u.e traumatized when she was just over a year old. Her mother had been killed by poachers. She was distrustful, and wanted nothing to do with the team. The dedicated keepers at @r.e.s.c.u.e didn't give up. They spent day and night, talking, singing, offering her seed pods and fresh grass‚Äîanything they could think of to win her over so that she would accept a bottle. Then, one day, after one of the keepers stood with her for an hour in a stack of tires, she finally took a bottle, and a strong bond was formed.

Shaba has been the proxy matriarch at the sanctuary since @r.e.s.c.u.e's founding in 2016. She would take care of the newly arrived orphans, making sure they were protected and felt nurtured when they were vulnerable and weak. She taught all of the keepers how to be with these beautiful creatures who needed help. It was a delight to watch her teaching the younger ones how to navigate steep paths, to strip bark from trees and find the freshest browse. It was unforgettable seeing her comfort the little ones with a reassuring gesture of her trunk.

Our hearts are full knowing that she is back in the wild where she belongs. We will never forget her. To everyone‚Äôs delight, Shaba, Pokot and Mpala have successfully integrated into one of the wild herds near the sanctuary. This is the best outcome we could have hoped for.

@conservationorg @kenyawildlifeservice @nrt_kenya @sandiegozoo @tusk_org @davematthewsband @thephotosociety @photography.for.good @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @nikonusa @magicalkenya #protectelephants #bekindtoelephants #DontLetThemDisappear #elephants #saveelephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #photojournalism #amivitale #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador"
"Photo by @amivitale. Cattle owned by the Fulani Mbororo are milked before they head out to graze in the early morning hours near a remote village in Chad. The Mbororo people are nomadic cattle-herders and traders and move every few days with their animals in search of fresh grazing land and water.

I'm here on behalf of @rippleeffectimages documenting the work of Hindou Oumarou Ibrahim (@hindououmar), who is working to harness the centuries of wisdom and weather-predicting techniques among the indigenous Mbororo to adapt to the impact of climate change. @hindououmar is a leader in both AFPAT (Association of Peul Women and Autochthonous Peoples of Chad) and within the @UN advocate for the powerful role indigenous people have in addressing climate change. Watch for her powerful talks as she takes the stage this week at #COP25. @hindououmar's work most recently earned her the prestigious 2019 Pritzker Environmental Genius Award administered by  @uclaioes that I was proud to nominate her for.

Follow me and @rippleeffectimages for more updates from this powerful story of empowerment and climate advocacy.

@conservationorg @photography.for.good @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety @nikonusa #PritzkerEnvironmentalGeniusAward #inspiring #inspiration #humanitarian #wisdom #climatechange #mitigation #pritzkergeniusaward #globalwarming #adaption #mbororo #indigenous #indigneouspeople #letgirlslearn #mothers #daughters #educateagirl #thefutureisfemale #education #globalwarming #climateemergency #climateadvocacy #climateadaption #therippleeffect #rippleeffectimages #rippleeffect"
"Photo by @amivitale. I'm delighted to be in Chad documenting the work of Hindou Oumarou Ibrahim (@hindououmar), an advocate for the powerful role indigenous people have in addressing climate change, both through her role at AFPAT (Association of Peul Women and Autochthonous Peoples of Chad) and in her talks at the @un. @hindououmar's mother is the force behind all of these incredible women. She was ridiculed for selling her wealth to make sure her daughters went to school when no one else did. Now people stop to congratulate her because she is doing powerful work to help her communities and this world. It‚Äôs such an honor to be here and share this inspiring story. Thank you to @anniegriffithsphotography and @rippleeffectimages for sending me here to capture this story and to @uclaioes for recognizing @hindououmar with the much deserved 2019 Pritzker Environmental Genius Award.

Follow @rippleeffectimages for more updates from this powerful story of education, change, empowerment and climate advocacy.

@conservationorg @photography.for.good @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety @nikonusa #PritzkerEnvironmentalGeniusAward #inspiring #inspiration #humanitarian #wisdom #climatechange #mitigation #pritzkergeniusaward #globalwarming #adaption #mbororo #indigenous #indigneouspeople #letgirlslearn #mothers #daughters #educateagirl #thefutureisfemale #education #nikonnofilter #nikonlove #globalwarming #climateemergency #climateadvocacy #climateadaption #therippleeffect #rippleeffectimages #rippleeffect"
Photo by @amivitale. Najin, one of the last two northern white rhinos on the planet grazes at her home at @OlPejeta Conservancy in northern Kenya. Thanks to the incredible work of a devoted team, there is hope, however, that more northern white rhinos may still follow her. An extraordinary constortium from Leibniz Institute for Zoo and Wildlife Research (@leibnizizw) #Avantea, @OlPejeta Conservancy, @KenyaWildlifeService and @SafariParkDvurKralove just successfully created two northern white rhino embryos from eggs extracted from the last two living female northern white rhinos. These embryos are now stored in liquid nitrogen to be transferred into a surrogate mother in the near future. You can help support this important initiative by donating to the @BioRescue_Project (Link in profile). @bmbf.bund @leibnizgemeinschaft @MinistryOfTourismAndWildlifeKE @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety @nikonusa @photography.for.good #NorthernWhiteRhinos #nikonambassador #northernwhiterhinos #dontletthemdisappear #nikonnofilter #nikonlove #kenya #rhinos #saverhinos
"Photo by @amivitale. Joseph Wachira (@wachira.joseph) holds the October issue of @natgeo featuring a photo of him with Sudan, the last male northern white rhino that was alive on the planet moments before he passed away due to age related complications at @OlPejeta Conservancy in northern Kenya. It was a heartbreaking moment. I took a photo of two old friends together for the last time. Those final moments were quiet‚Äîthe rain falling, a single bird scolding, and the muffled sorrow of Sudan‚Äôs caretakers.

Through this heartbreak has come hope. An extraordinary team from Leibniz Institute for Zoo and Wildlife Research (@leibnizizw) #Avantea, @OlPejeta Conservancy, @KenyaWildlifeService and @SafariParkDvurKralove just successfully created two northern white rhino embryos from eggs extracted from the last two living female northern white rhinos. These embryos are now stored in liquid nitrogen to be transferred into a surrogate mother in the near future. You can help support this important initiative by donating to the @BioRescue_Project (Link in profile). @bmbf.bund @leibnizgemeinschaft @MinistryOfTourismAndWildlifeKE @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety @nikonusa @photography.for.good #NorthernWhiteRhinos #nikonambassador #northernwhiterhinos #dontletthemdisappear #nikonnofilter #nikonlove #kenya #rhinos #saverhinos"

Everyone needs a bubble machine #backyardbubbles #home thanks @snarlakarla
I live in the Hudson Valley of New York with my husband and daughter. When we moved here about 10 years ago, I wasn‚Äôt sure if it would feel rural enough and if we would connect to the landscape. These images reflect the deep and personal relationship we have built with this beautiful place ‚Äì our home. There‚Äôs our favorite swimming hole, fishing streams and the rail trail we run and walk along almost every day. We are moving to Upstate NY this summer and I will miss these places and moments but look forward to discovering a connection in our new home.  @apple #ApplePartner #hudsonvalley #home #wallkillvalleyrailtrail @mattmoyerphoto @thephotosociety
World Refugee Day | Thinking about children today on World Refugee Day. According to the UNHCR, an unprecedented 70.8 million people around the world have been forced from their homes. Among them are nearly 25.9 million refugees, over half of whom are under the age of 18. Through my work as a photographer and educator I‚Äôve partnered with a number of organizations who are doing amazing work with children living in camps, hiding in cities around the globe or helping kids settle in host countries. Here‚Äôs a few organizations to acknowledge and support today @refugepoint @bcccrefugeeyouthproject @mvrc_refugees @projectamalousalam @ngphotocamp

‚ÄúAfter all... tomorrow is another day.‚Äù On assignment for @nature_org  in Cheyenne, Wyoming. #gonewiththewind #lincolntheatercheyenne

A long #walkabout today around the bustling morning markets in #Jakarta. Set to be the largest city on Earth by 2030. I found these guys battling vampires the old fashioned way. I appreciated that. Remember, when you can‚Äôt find good light, find the absence of it. #sonya7iii @sonyalpha #50mm
Streets of Jakarta. Haven‚Äôt had this much wondering around in a big city in quite some time. Some throw shade and that‚Äôs okay. For those throwing the occasion smile at me, I completely light up.
"[GIVEAWAY CLOSED] This #GivingTuesday I am excited for the opportunity to give something back as a sincere thank you!!! @ZodiacWatches supported our recent @SeaLegacy expedition to Timor Leste and now one of you will have the chance to win our limited edition #SuperSeaWolf 68 Saturation x Andy Mann watch. Only 182 of these beautiful Swiss timepieces were made. Swipe to see in closer detail. So honored to be working with a do-good brand like @ZodiacWatches and looking forward to sharing the stories from our expedition with you really soon. See how to enter below ‚Äî I will announce a winner tomorrow on my stories. Good luck!!! #DiveWithPurpose

How to enter:

2. Make sure you're already following me and @zodiacwatches

First photo by @mitty"
I enjoyed spending time with this man today, somewhere outside Bandung, West Java. He would only speak to me through his marionette. I asked if I could take his picture and the marionette said ‚Äútidak‚Äù which means no. Then we shared a smoke. I don‚Äôt even smoke. But the marionette lightened up after that. Thanks wizard for the memory.
Delving ever deeper into Indonesia‚Äôs mainland today. Letting the moments find me. It‚Äôs been an interesting and unexpected week, filled to the brim with ups and downs. Looking forward to the adventure to come.
I am forever fascinated by the art of flight. In Svalbard, a tern hovers stationary above the icy waters, timing her kill. @naturalworldsafaris
Why am I so happy? We just finished one of the wildest, most successful @sealegacy expeditions to date, logging countless hours in the water with blue whales and documenting the most biodiverse coral reefs on the planet alongside my friends @paulnicklen @mitty @samkretch @fizzyfarfaraway @ryantidman @kyle.roepke throughout Timor Leste. A huge thank you to @zodiacwatches for funding this important expedition, allowing us to do the work needed to help protect this fragile environment. Follow @zodiacwatches for exclusive content from the trip and stay tuned for a big post coming on Giving Tuesday! Lots of love y‚Äôall. üíôüêã
Oceanic whitetips, gathered and ready. It‚Äôs so rare to get this many oceanics within any resemblance of an ‚Äúorganized‚Äù frame. I love it when it happens though. Such a special evening out in the deep. Follow along with us @sealegacy for a deeper look into the many Bahamas ecosystems and many challenges facing this fragile island nation.
A great white shark about to breach the cold waters off of Guadelupe Island, Mexico. Resembling a certain movie poster, this image was the result of practice, patience & a hell of a lot of luck. Situated in the Pacific, 240km off Mexico‚Äôs Baja California peninsula, Guadalupe is one of the world‚Äôs premier locations for observing great white sharks. Approx 200 people reside on the island, most of them abalone and lobster fisherman. @sonyalpha #a9 #bealpha @sealegacy #sharks #uwphotography
Today is the official launch of the new @zodiacwatches Super Sea Wolf 68 Saturation X Andy Mann Edition. (Link in Bio) Whoa! What a ride it has been the last 14 months designing this piece inspired by my muse, the Oceanic Whitetip Shark. When the team at Zodiac asked me to design a dive watch inspired by my ocean adventures, I took it seriously. I flew to Biel, Switzerland to study with third-generation watchmakers, work on the design and break a few Swiss watchmaking traditions along the way (thanks guys!) The Oceanic Whitetip was recently listed under the Endangered Species Act and I‚Äôm proud to continue documenting the science being done to help it recover. A huge thank you to Zodiac for not only helping me through this process but fully funding our next @sealegacy expedition to Timor Leste next month! It's time to let her fly! #DivewithPurpose #ZodiacWatches
Storm rolling over Fitz Roy and friends down in Patagonia. Dreamland down there. Fun times back in 2013 with @ladzinski.
The winds are changing up in the Colorado high country. That chilly thin autumn air is the finest of wine. Checking out the new @fotopro.usa Eagle Series tripod (swipe right). Insane for ye olde long lens. Currently loving it with the @sonyalpha 400mm 2.8 for my morning light missions with friends. @scottcrady. üçÅüçÅüçÅ.

"The official theme of today‚Äôs #worldaidsday is ‚ÄúCommunities Make The Difference‚Äù... The theme recognises the vital role that communities are playing both to prevent new HIV infections, and deliver life-saving health services to people already living with HIV. 
This resonates deeply at mothers2mothers a community and organization im proud to be a part of since 2015.
Their peer-based model is rooted in the communities they serve. Every day, they witness the power of African women employed and trained as frontline health workers who deliver transformative health outcomes in their OWN communities as what we call ‚ÄòMentor Mothers‚Äô. Since starting in 2001, m2m has employed more than 10,000 local women who, together, have reached more than 11 million women and children!  Only together we can create a generation free of HIV ‚ô•Ô∏è"

‚ÄúLife is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don‚Äôt resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.‚Äù Lao Tzu #taoist #tao #mindfulness #earthfocus
The beginning of this year started out a bit funky for me. I tried to stay positive and kept telling myself... change your thoughts. Inside I felt gloomy, tired, and uninspired. There are so many motivational, mindsets, and things we can do to uplift our spirits but if we don‚Äôt embrace how we honestly feel then that feeling will never go away. It‚Äôs okay to not be positive, happy, and 100% all the time. Sometimes our spirit is releasing suppressed emotions or processing internally. Don‚Äôt resist and feel ashamed. "Will miss you Switzerland üá®üá≠! What an incredible place this has been. I tried packing light for this trip but with the cold weather and electronics I need to take with me for work, it still weighs in. @troylindner and I did not factor in the staircases in Europe and so when we stayed at @hotelsilberhornwengen we finally got a chance to really relaxed on the trip üò¥ .

Jungfrau is a super beautiful region to visit. One major thing to note is everyone  must leave their car in a parking lot before entering up the region by @jungfraujochtopofeurope railway üöÉ . You also must bring all the belongings you want into the train to get to up into town - where most of the beautiful hotels are. Most hotels are up wavy pathways and staircases. Great for backpackers! Luckily for us hotel Silberhorn was right across the train station with a magnificent view. It was a great break from all the carrying we had to do. The whole stay was quiet and and very beautiful (swipe to see!). Thank you for the incredible experience of a lifetime! üôèüá®üá≠‚ù§Ô∏è #jungfraujoch #hotelsilberhorn #troyanntravels"
One of my favorite experiences in Switzerland is the Jungfrau train ride up lol üôå‚ú® The scenery is phenomenal!!! What a scenic ride up to the top of Europe ‚ù§Ô∏èüá®üá≠An experience worth doing in this lifetime! Thank you to all my European and traveler friends for giving me your recommendations, suggestions, and feedback to places! I also enjoy hearing about your traveling experiences ‚ù§Ô∏è Thank you @jungfraujochtopofeurope for making this dream come to life üôèüá®üá≠‚ù§Ô∏è #jungfraujoch üì∑ @troylindner

–ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ —É —Ç–µ–±—è —Ä–æ–∂–¥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫ –∏ —Ç–µ–±–µ —Ç–æ –ª–∏ –≤ —à—É—Ç–∫—É –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç, —Ç–æ –ª–∏ –≤ —Å–µ—Ä—å–µ–∑, –æ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ —É–∂–µ —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –Ω–∞–¥–æ –≤—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –≥–¥–µ-—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–º –≤ –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥—å –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª—É, —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ —Å —É–º–∞ —Å–æ—à–ª–∏üòÖ —á—Ç–æ –¥–æ 7 –ª–µ—Ç –µ—â—ë –∫–∞–∫ –¥–æ –õ—É–Ω—ã –∏ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æüòÜ 
–ê –æ–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –≤–∂—É—É—Ö, –∏ –≤–æ—Ç —É–∂–µ —Ä—è–¥–æ–º. –ò –∫–∞–∫ –∂–µ —è —Ä–∞–¥–∞, —á—Ç–æ –º—ã –µ–µ —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –Ω–µ –æ—Ç–¥–∞–ª–∏ –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≥–æ–¥—É –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª—É. –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ —ç—Ç–æ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ —Ä–∞–¥—É—é—Å—åüòÖ –•–æ—Ç—è –ù–∞—Å—Ç–∏–Ω –ø–µ–¥–∞–≥–æ–≥ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –µ–π –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Å–∫—É—á–Ω–æ –≤ —Å–ª–µ–¥ –≥–æ–¥—É —É—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª–µ. –ù–æ —Å —ç—Ç–∏–º –º—ã –ø–æ–∑–∂–µ —Ä–∞–∑–±–µ—Ä—ë–º—Å—è)"
"–ò—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è —Å –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ —á—É–¥–æ-–ø–æ–º–æ—â–Ω–∏–∫–∞ #dysonV11 –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞—è. –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –¥–µ—Ç–∏ –≤ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏–∏ –±–æ–ª–µ—é—Ç, —Ç–æ –Ω–µ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—à—å –≤ –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–µ –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ —Ü–µ–ª—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—åüò© –ù–∞–º –ø–æ–≤–µ–∑–ª–æ, —Å –Ω–∞–º–∏ –±—ã–ª–∏ –±–∞–±—É—à–∫–∏, –∏ –º—ã –º–µ–Ω—è–ª–∏—Å—å —Å –Ω–∏–º–∏. –û–¥–Ω–∞–∂–¥—ã –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —É–±–æ—Ä–∫–∏ –Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–∞, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Å –¥–µ—Ç—å–º–∏ —Å–∏–¥–µ–ª–∞ –º–∞–º–∞, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ —Ä—É–∫–∞–º–∏ –º–∞—Ö–∞–ª–∞ –∏ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–æ –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ —á—É–¥–æ –∞–ø–ø–∞—Ä–∞—Ç –±–µ–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∞üò±, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –æ—á–∏—Å—Ç–∏–ª –≤—Å–µ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫ –≤–∞–ª—è–ª–æ—Å—å –∏ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ! 
–Ø –∂–µ –ª—é–±–ª—é –º–∞–º—É) –∏ –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ —É–ª–æ–≤–∏–ª–∞ –Ω–∞–º—ë–∫üòå –ò –≤–æ—Ç –º—ã —É–∂–µ –≤ –¥–µ–ª–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±—É–µ–º –º–æ—â–Ω—ã–π –±–µ—Å–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π Dyson V11 Absoluteüòç 
–£ –º–∞–º—ã –¥–æ–º–∞ –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–≤—ë—Ä –Ω–∞ –≤—Å—é –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω—É—é –∏ –º–Ω–æ–∂–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –¥–∏–≤–∞–Ω–æ–≤ –∏ –∫—Ä–µ—Å–µ–ª. –£ –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–µ—Ç –∫–æ–≤—Ä–æ–≤, –Ω–æ —É–≥–ª–æ–≤ —Å—Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å–æ—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å.
–í –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Ç–µ –∫ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ø—ã–ª–µ—Å–æ—Å—É –∏–¥–µ—Ç –º–Ω–æ–∂–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –Ω–∞—Å–∞–¥–æ–∫, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–º–∏ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —É–±–∏—Ä–∞—Ç—å —Å–∞–º—ã–µ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –∏ –ø–æ–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏—è –≤ –¥–æ–º–µ. –ê –µ—â–µ —É –Ω–µ–≥–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è –Ω–∞—Å–∞–¥–∫–∞, —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –≤ —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º–µ –ê–≤—Ç–æ –ø—ã–ª–µ—Å–æ—Å —Å–∞–º –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç —Ç–∏–ø –ø–æ–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏—è –∏ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç —Å–≤–æ—é –º–æ—â–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤—Å–∞—Å—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è! 
–ó–∞—Ä—è–∂–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ–Ω –æ—Ç –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏—Ç –±–∞—Ç–∞—Ä–µ—é –¥–æ 60–º–∏–Ω! –ú–Ω–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —á–µ–º —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ —É–±–æ—Ä–∫—É –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –¥–æ–º–∞.
–ê –µ–≥–æ —Ñ–∏–ª—å—Ç—Ä –∑–∞–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –¥–æ 99,97% –º–∏–∫—Ä–æ—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—Üüò± –ù–∏–∫–∞–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–∑–±—Ä–æ—Å–∞ –±–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–π! 
–¢–∞–±–ª–æ (–Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ–º —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ) –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å –∑–∞—Ä—è–¥–∫–∏ –∏ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º —É–±–æ—Ä–∫–∏, –Ω–æ –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–µ–ø–æ–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –æ–Ω–∏ –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–º –∫–æ—Å–º–æ—Å–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å)

"–í –æ–±—â–µ–º, –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è –¥–æ –Ω–µ–≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –¥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∫–∞—è.

–í —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑ –±—ã–ª–æ —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º –º–Ω–æ–≥–æüò≠ –£ –º–∞–º—ã —Å—É–º–æ—á–∫–∞ —Å —Ä—é–∫–∑–∞–∫–æ–º –∏ –ø–∞–∫–µ—Ç–∏–∫ —Å —Å–∞–ø–æ–≥–∞–º–∏ –∏ –ø—É—Ö–æ–≤–∏–∫–æ–º. –¢–æ–∂–µ —Å–∞–º–æ–µ —É –º–∞–º—ã –î–∏–º—ã. –¢—Ä–æ–µ –¥–µ—Ç–µ–π, –¥–µ—Ç—Å–∫–∏–π —Ä—é–∫–∑–∞–∫, –ù–∞—Å—Ç–∏–Ω —á–µ–º–æ–¥–∞–Ω –ø—Ä–æ–∑—Ä–∞—á–Ω—ã–π (—Å–æ–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –¥–ª—è —Ä—É—á–Ω–æ–π –∫–ª–∞–¥–∏), –º–æ—è —Å—É–º–æ—á–∫–∞, –µ—â—ë –æ–¥–Ω–∞ —Å —à–ª—è–ø–∞–º–∏, –∫–æ–ª—è—Å–∫–∞!

–ù–∞ –ø–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–º –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–µ –≤ –∞—ç—Ä–æ–ø–æ—Ä—Ç—É –î—É–±–∞—è –î–∏–º—É —Ä–∞–∑–≤–æ—Ä–∞—á–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç –∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –ê—ç—Ä–æ—Ñ–ª–æ—Ç –≤—ã–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª –ø–æ—Å–∞–¥–æ—á–Ω—ã–π —Ç–∞–ª–æ–Ω –Ω–∞ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–±—ë–Ω–∫–∞! –ö–∞–∫ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å! –í—ã –æ–±—ã—á–Ω–æ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä—è–µ—Ç–µ –±–∏–ª–µ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ 7 —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫?üò≠üò≠

He was kind, he was humble, he was gentle and he was brilliant . A maestro, as I always called him. Subbu will always remain one of the most loved and respected makeup artists in the country. He made me look beautiful every time he touched my face with his exceptional skills. And will be remembered for all the beautiful work he has left behind and all the lives he has touched. A wonderful son and brother and a beautiful soul has left us today. May you rest in peace Subbu üôèüíú

"The new Culture & Arts Centre by @zahahadidarchitects is now open. The building incorporates a contemporary art museum (MICA), an 1,800-seat theatre with supporting facilities and a multipurpose hall. Its organic architectural language is defined by pedestrian routes that weave through the site to connect with neighbouring streets. / üì∏ @VirgileBertrand_HK_Photo
