565 Broome SoHo stunning luxury condominium building designed by world-renowned firm @rpbw_architects and interiors by Parisian firm Rena Dumas Architecture Interieure is the first residential building in New York City designed by Pritzker Prize winning architect #RenzoPiano. / üì∏ @annamorgowicz
@madarchitects has completed the restoration and reconstruction of a 305 sqm traditional courtyard house by adding two bubble-like workspaces to its roof. ‚ÄúHutong Bubble 218‚Äù is a continuation of MAD‚Äôs exploration into urban renovations as a means of revitalizing the Chinese capital‚Äôs old neighborhoods that have been confronted with degradation and demolition as a result of rapid development. MAD‚Äôs renovation demonstrates how small-scale, artistic interventions can provide new spaces and programs for these adverse areas, creating a dialogue between the old and the new. / üì∏ @tianfangfang2019
"Eretz, S√£o Paulo, Brazil, 2016 / Project by @fernandamarquesarquiteta / üì∏ @fernandogguerra
.
#architecture #archilovers"
London-based @flow.architecture with Maria Grazia Savito have extensively redeveloped a Victorian terraced house in London. The project consists of the complete demolition and reconstruction of the existing dwelling ‚Äî a large four-storey end-of-terrace house, originally built in 1851 ‚Äî together with the addition of a basement and a double-height rear-extension. Natural light plays a key role in the project: two large frameless skylights are positioned at the top of the courtyard and the open staircase to enhance the permeability of the building. As a result, abundant daylight fills the heart of the dwelling, carving out the volumes from the original mass and creating a series of fascinating effects. / üì∏ @studio_naaro
"Located in the city of Merida, Yucatan, @filuxlab represents a versatile space that works as a gallery, as a workshop and as a place of coexistence, camaraderie and research for artistic purposes.
The ground floor has five rooms, which were part of the original structure of the house before the intervention. The pasta floor carpets of the first corridor are the originals. An edge of Antique White color mosaics joins the originals to the new flooring, which unites old and new flooring across the entirety of the space. The design of the laboratory enables it to adapt according to its intended use. All the elements that make up its architecture including floors, walls, ceilings, and doors can be used for artistic interventions. White and neutral colors came from this same need. / üì∏ @tamarauribeph"
Volumi sospesi, Monza, Italy, 2019 / Project by @tommasogiunchi üìå Featured Product: MESH pendant lamp by @luceplan_lighting

One of my favorite photos from #Svaneti, Georgia!  Lit-up by burning birch torches in the shadows of 13th century towers, villagers in Mulakhi pour alcohol on the graves of relatives in a ceremony/festival called Lamproba (Lamps Festival). The festival pre-dates the arrival of Christianity and is one of the oldest preserved traditions in the region of its kind.  Ive heard two stories of its meaning:  One says the lamps were to warm the souls of the dead, another story said it was a pagan ritual asking the deities for healthy crops and good weather.  #Sakartvelo for @natgeo
The villages of Ushguli in #Svaneti (Georgia) are even more dramatic when the snows fall!  Completely cut off from the outside world on days like this, these UNESCO world heritage sites look as they must have when these defensive towers were built in the 13th Century.  An unpublished photo from an assignment for @natgeo.
Missing the mountains and mysteries of #Svaneti.  So many beautiful rituals to have witnessed.  Lighting candles in the Lagurka church in Kala, #Sakartvelo.  Unpublished image from a story for @natgeo magazine.
At the Quiricoba Festival in Kala, #Svanetia (in the country of Georgia), young men compete to lift a 300+ lb stone, with the goal of throwing it over their head to land behind them.  Most cannot get the stone off the ground.  Shot on assignment for @NatGeo. #StrongMan Contest #Sakartvelo #DinosaurEgg?
An older image of mine that feels more timely every year.  I wrote a short piece about this assignment for @harpersmagazine called ‚Äúa temporary apocalypse‚Äù talking about the feeling of dropping into emergency zones like big wildfires.  But now all these temporary apocalypses seem to be merging into one big one that never end... #wearetheasteroid (From the Yorba Linda-Corona fire of 2008)
#Sponsored by @GeorgiaTravel // A long time ago, with my first camera, I was lucky enough to stumble into the country of Georgia and it changed my life.  It was waaaay off the beaten path, and #Svanetia, an isolated region surrounded by 17,000 ft peaks, where villages are still made up of clusters of 13th Century defensive towers, was like a dream made real.  It is still a place that feels completely out of time with hikes among the clouds for the adventurous traveller.  To see more of this stunning country follow #GeorgiaTravelMoments
Fall leaf piles with @junohuey in the back yard.

"While I was making a portrait of a teenager holding a slice of pizza in a blizzard in Unalaska, Alaska... this fox entered the frame and just stood there. 
Story by @laurel_braitman and myself was published in @californiasunday mag a couple years back. We were recreating the scene of a crime where a bald eagle had snatched a piece of pizza out of Ethan‚Äôs hand while he walked down the street. You can find it on the google by typing ‚ÄúDirty Birds‚Äù and my name or Laurel Braitman‚Äôs. It‚Äôs one of the best stories I‚Äôve ever worked on and since I‚Äôm now stalking coyotes, seemed relevant. 
#fox #urbanwildlife #humananimals #dutchharbor #unalaska #portrait #alaska #blizzard #portraitphotography #californiasundaymagazine"
"Doing some camera trap testing in the backyard with our coyote stand in puppy. @alynicklas and I have owned this little puppipodimous for a couple months now, and she is proving to be a stellar photo assistant. "My obsession with photographing human/wildlife relationships can be traced back to this image I made in San Francisco back in 1999. I used to stay up all night prowling around the Presidio making night photos and hoping a raccoon or skunk would cross my path... usually afraid of me, this little dude straight up tried to attack me on the street, snarling and charging me trying to get the bag of chips in my hand. It‚Äôs a two second exposure on medium format film. Kind of a miracle he isn‚Äôt a blur ball. Raccoons have always been an obsession of mine and I‚Äôve spend the past 20 years talking about this grand raccoon photo project I‚Äôve been wanting to explore. And so finally the time has come. Armed with a National Geographic Storytelling grant to collaborate with the amazing writer @laurel_braitman on a story about Raccoon intelligence, and with additional support to photograph an Urban Carnivore feature for @natgeo Magazine, I‚Äôm spending much of the next year digging around your backyards for amazing scenes of raccoon, coyote, and bear debauchery. I‚Äôm gonna need help, so thank you already for the flood of tips about where to find coyotes in Chicago. I‚Äôll keep y‚Äôall informed when I‚Äôm heading to your neighborhood! Meanwhile I live in Portland, so tips here always welcome!

Prints available @hartmanfineart 
#urbanwildlife #urbancarnivores #raccoon #racoon #sanfrancisco #night #raccoonsofinstagram #presidio #natgeo #onassignment #humananimals"
"To add a bit more context to my last post, this is the insanely tight sandstone cave tunnel where I followed wildlife biologist Wesley Larson @grizkid to a 350 pound black bear waking from hibernation at the other end. I‚Äôm not sure how this tunnel was formed, perhaps long ago carved by water and wind, but meeting a bear in there without enough room for us to even turn around seemed pretty hairy at the time. The purpose of this trip was to replace the bears radio tracking collar which was being used to gather data and help mitigate dangerous human / bear encounters in Bryce Canyon National Park. The photos in this carousel show a bit more of the entrance and a shot of Wes looking back maybe wondering if this was a good idea:) I‚Äôm grateful for the chance to follow these guys in action... the complete story can be found in the link in my bio, or in the December 2019 issue of National Geographic Magazine! Spoiler: the bear and all the humans involved are all alive and well:) Also thanks to everyone that sent me urban coyote finding tips in Chicago! 
#bear #blackbear #natgeo #hibernation #caving #fear #claustrophobia #onassignment #brycecanyonnationalpark @natgeo"
"A few years back i was invited by a young wildlife biologist named Wes Larson @grizkid to follow him and his team as they studied the behavior of black bears near Bryce Canyon National Park, Utah. But I was never prepared to crawl face to face with 350 pound bear waking from hibernation 70 feet deep into a claustrophobic sandstone tunnel. You can find my account of the story and how it all ended in the December 2019 issue of National Geographic Magazine. ‚ÄúThrough the Lens: Don‚Äôt Wake the Bear‚Äù or click the link in my bio to read the story online! @natgeo 
By the way, I‚Äôm in Chicago next week on the lookout for Urban #coyotes and #raccoons in your backyard! DM me if you have any leads on where to find them. Thanks! 
#natgeo #bear #hibernation #blackbear #wildlifebiology #humananimals #wildlife #brycecanyon #utah #wild"

"In love for this project!! Suspended Boxes by @masoudabedimoghadam 
The main idea behind designing this project was to define a new definition for the relationship between the architecture and nature. This project tries to break the conventional description of the border by merging itself in the context.
The architecture has been utterly melted in the forest, and the border between them has been faded. So, the building doesn't impose itself on the context, and tries to establish an intimate friendship with it by allowing the context to penetrate into its heart."

"Hi everyone! @maximetch  here. I'm super honored to be taking over the @artofvisuals instagram today. I'm a landscape and adventure photographer based in Brittany, France. I found my passion for photography 3 years ago during a trip in Canada. Now I can‚Äôt spend a day without taking any photos.‚Ä®I wanted to share with you the best sunrise I‚Äôve seen this year in the French Pyrenees (first photo). The hardest hike I‚Äôve ever done is probably that one because of the weather. The first day up was really foggy. We couldn‚Äôt see anything during the last hour of the hike. A bunch of horses were running in the fog a few meters in front of us. We slept close to this lovely lake and met 2 campers on our way. We woke up at 5.30 am with a clear sky. We hiked to the summit (30/40 min from the lake) and had the best surprise of the year. So worth it : 360view over the Pyrenees, a perfect light and birdsongs. Can‚Äôt complain don‚Äôt you think ? I hope you guys enjoy my takeover today. Free feel to reach out if you'd like to chat about anything :) Be Visually Inspired By! @maximetch 
#artofvisuals #bevisuallyinspired #aov #creators #thursdaytakeover"

THANK U HARLEM NYC X @c.syresmith X @iloveyourestaurant FOR SUCH A GREAT TURNOUT AND EXPERIENCE ü•ò
THOT TWAT TIRADE$
Finallllllyyy the end of a long competition seasonü•µ. My first time competing on the World Cup circuit and Olympic qualifying events was exhilarating. It opened my eyes to the hectic schedule that athletes go through year after year. Up until 2019, I was competing in a handful of global competitions a year and focused on school and outdoor climbing goals for the most part. This year, with the Olympics around the corner, I was competing in a different country almost every other week. Preparing for speed, bouldering and lead was a perplexing obstacle all athletes had to deal with after the announcement of the new combined format. It was a big battle of figuring out the right balance of training/ rest for each discipline that still baffles me. There were many moments of joy and laughter on the road and inevitably exhaustion and doubt tagged along as well. The deeper into the season I went, the more ‚Äúworn out‚Äù I felt from the constant tension and pressure of competition climbing. My performance also worsened because of this clouded mindset I developed. Qualifications for the Olympics has been a big goal of mine but this time it didn‚Äôt happen. I‚Äôm incredibly proud of @kyra_condie , @brookeclimbs and @nathaniel.coleman for climbing superbly and getting tix to Tokyo 2020. It was an honor to be able to represent the USA with an incredible crew of coaches, PTs and athletes. Thank you @joshlrsn @heymerg and @zgdicristino for being there for us.üôè time to switch things up and do some climbing on rocks üèú‚õ∞
To infinityüß†‚ù§Ô∏è! @thenorthface @wearebraindead

Hold on to the good onesü§ûhappy birthday to this badass young lady @bea.evans !!!! üëë BBG squad shall reunite soonüíò @sienna_kopf @vandamichalkova

"Last night, I had the chance to sit down with Stacey Abrams to talk about how Democrats can win up and down the ballot in 2020. There‚Äôs a lot of great work already happening: Stacey‚Äôs Fair Fight effort to end voter suppression, Eric Holder‚Äôs National Democratic Redistricting Committee to draw fair maps, and a lot of big-hearted, forward-looking candidates and campaigns to get people registered and out to the polls.‚Å£
‚Å£
The truth is we win when people vote. The more energized we are, the better organized we are as a party, the better the outcome. We believe in the ideals of equality and democracy, freedom of thought and religion. We rally around the notion that we are all bound together and a belief that civil argument can lead us to a more perfect union. We commit ourselves to the principles that are embodied in our Constitution. And we have to remember that our faith is tested at hard times, not at easy times. That‚Äôs how this works. So I hope all of us‚Äîas citizens, as volunteers, as Americans who simply believe that we can make this country better‚Äîare ready to get marching, get organizing, and get voting. It‚Äôs up to us."
Every time I leave Chicago, I leave with a little more hope. Over the years, I‚Äôve made some pretty remarkable memories here, and today we added one more at the @ObamaFoundation Summit. Hearing the stories of the young people shaping our future has reaffirmed for me that there‚Äôs no challenge we can‚Äôt overcome.
I came to Chicago in my 20s, still trying to figure out who I was. It was there that I found my community and my purpose. Excited to be back here for the @ObamaFoundation Summit to hear some remarkable stories from folks around the world‚Äîand share my own. I hope you‚Äôll tune in at obama.org
Samantha Power is a Pulitzer Prize winner, an incredible writer, and a great friend. And from my campaign through all eight years of my presidency, she was a key voice on my foreign policy team. In her highly personal and reflective memoir, The Education of an Idealist, she grapples with the balance between idealism, pragmatism, advocacy and governance. It‚Äôs a must-read for anyone who cares about our role in a changing world.
The Pacific has always been a part of me. Growing up in Hawai ªi and Indonesia, with the guidance of my mother and grandparents, I learned to appreciate the wonders and beauty of the region. During my time in elected office and in the years since, I saw the many ways that the Asia-Pacific region has positioned itself to take advantage of tremendous opportunities. It‚Äôs home to a remarkable generation of emerging leaders, women and men poised to take on some of the greatest challenges our planet has ever faced. Earlier this year, I had a chance to meet with a few of these folks as we designed the @ObamaFoundation Leaders: Asia-Pacific program. And today, I‚Äôm excited to say that Michelle and I will be joining the program‚Äôs inaugural gathering in Malaysia in December. We‚Äôll talk about the importance of ethical leadership‚Äîhow staying true to your values is the only way to truly carry out lasting change. I couldn‚Äôt be prouder of all the leaders selected to join this program‚Äîall the work they‚Äôve already accomplished, and all the good work that is yet to come.
As President, I leaned on @ambsusanrice‚Äôs experience, expertise, and willingness to tell me what I needed to hear. In her memoir, Tough Love, you‚Äôll see why. It‚Äôs a tribute to American leadership‚Äîand a unifying call for us to do our part to protect it. I hope you‚Äôll read it.

"FULL BODY Core! Bookmarküîñfor later!
‚†Ä 
These 4 exercises with light hand weights will give you more muscle üí™üèª for your hustle! Watch the full video üìπ or swipe‚¨ÖÔ∏èto see each exercise.
‚†Ä 
I took these 4 from my newest class Fit to the CORE out on Monday. ‚û°Ô∏èI love incorporating light hand weights into Pilates core work for a full body üî• burn.
‚†Ä 
Video 1:
Pilates Cross Crawl (optional weights). If you are using weights, make sure to be carful of the neck and shoulders. If you feel any pulling, set the head down or don‚Äôt use the weights. This exercise works the deep core and adding weights work the shoulders as well!
‚†Ä 
Video 2: 
Hollow Body Press. Again optional weight however the weight will add an inner thigh component that you don‚Äôt get without the weight. Support the neck with the hands or lay the head down on the floor.
‚†Ä 
Video 3: 
Flying Tiger. I love this exercise so much because it really does require you to focus and use the Transverse Abs to stay stable. The shoulder and the tricep get a nice burn as well as the hamstrings! So amazing!
‚†Ä 
Video 4:
Hydrant Plank Ups. Another awesome simple exercise with a surprise! Add the weight to the back of the knee for a nice hamstring burn. Add the hydrant to your dog and you are working into Glute medius then finish it off with knee to tricep to work the abs, shoulders, and Psoas!
‚†Ä

‚†Ä

"BLAST the ü¶á wings! 3 simple Pilates moves that will work the upper half!
‚†Ä 
If you have a hard time toning the arms, these 3 exercises are simple, & effective! üëâüèªBookmark üîñ and TAG a friend!
‚†Ä 
Video 1: Floating Table üî• Taps - these not only tone the shoulders but also the obliques. Exhale as you twist the hip and squeeze your obliques.
‚†Ä 
Video 2: Dolphin üê¨ hovers. These are deceptively hard. They work the triceps and core. Exhale as you tap the elbows down and float the knees.
‚†Ä 
Video 3: Boat ‚õµÔ∏è Fly. You can float the feet or keep them down (only toes) and open and close the arms like a chest fly. You want to press for arms together as you exhale and maintain a stable boat pose. These are way harder than they look!
‚†Ä

Want to try a few moves? Grab some blocks and try these 5 core exercises!
‚†Ä 
1. Knee to chest holds - works arms and core strength while building endurance. This is 1/2 the battle!

2. Leg lifts over a block - works the Psoas and lengthens the hamstrings. Yes, it burns like crazy!üî• 3. Leg Lift with Side Squat- this are so good!üíÉüèºWorks the mobility of the hip and also challenges the core. Use a block under the hip to modify!

3. Single Leg ups - more burning üî• but you can modify by leaning back a bit and not straightening the leg as far.

"When I was diagnosed with #Fibromyalgia, the doctor looked at me and said ‚Äúit‚Äôs okay, we have wonderful pain killers these days ...‚Äù I was only 23 years old.
‚†Ä 
He went on to tell me that I have an ‚Äúoveractive nervous system‚Äù and ‚Äúmore nerve endings in my body‚Äù which is why I am so sensitive to the touch. He also told me ‚Äúthere is no cure and I‚Äôd always have pain.‚Äùüòî
‚†Ä
In a way however, this made me feel validated because growing up I never wanted anyone to touch me and even the slightest bump or bruise felt like I got run over by a truck.
‚†Ä 
But ugh, I didn‚Äôt want to take pain killers ... I hated feeling groggy and out of it. There had to be another way.
‚†Ä 
My personality is such that if you tell me ‚Äúthere is no cure‚Äù, I‚Äôll prove you wrong or at least make a concerted effort.ü§ì
‚†Ä 
So that is what I did... I began my search (& study) of how to heal myself.
‚†Ä 
My search lead me to something miraculous. It‚Äôs called the mind-body connection and it absolutely changed my life.
‚†Ä 
All those feelings of not being good enough, bitterness, resentment and stress ... they were causing my ‚Äúoveractive nervous system‚Äù to be on high alert. My body stored negative emotion like a sponge and the end result was body pain, migraines and exhaustion.
‚†Ä 
I learned that my ‚Äúsensitivity‚Äù is actually a gift when I use it mindfully.üßòüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I learned that controlling stress, controls my symptoms and most importantly, I found out that being gentle and kind to myself is more powerful than any drug I could take.
‚†Ä 
It‚Äôs taken me over 20 years to finally arrive at this place in my life, but I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing. I now have the pleasure of sharing with others how to connect inward. I teach people through yoga and Pilates how to listen to their body, release stress & feel amazing!
‚†Ä 
I help others, no matter what they are going through, learn to be gentle and kind to themselves.üôèüèª
‚†Ä 
If you are struggling with pain, negative emotions, not feeling the way you want, feel free to reach out. Send me a DM or leave me a comment.‚ù§Ô∏è
‚†Ä 
If you want to learn more about the BYG Method click the link in my bio.üîó
‚†Ä 
Join the amazing BYG community! ‚†Ä 
www.beachyogagirl.com
‚†Ä 
#BYGMETHOD
‚†Ä"
"üî•4 #CORE exercises using a block that will train your deep abs (TVA). Bookmark üîñ and TAG a friend!
‚†Ä 
Do you know how to active your deep core muscles?
‚†Ä 
Do you know why it‚Äôs so important?
‚†Ä 
Our deep abdominals help to stabilize our spine and protect our organs. They also help relay messages from the brain to our limbs.
‚†Ä 
If you only train just what people can see (6 pack abs) you will be doing yourself a disservice not to mention missing out!!
‚†Ä 
Test how weak (or strong) your core actually is!
‚†Ä 
TAKE THE TEST
Balance a block on your knee and perform these 4 exercises:
‚†Ä 
Video 1: Side Plank with leg extension. Place the block on the hip bone (the highest point of balance) and try to perform the movement. Keep abs engaged and body completely still as you move the leg.
‚†Ä 
Video 2: Open and close the hip. Place the block on opposite knee. If TVA (transverse abs) is not engage, block will fall immediately. Try to do as many as you can slow and controlled on both sides. Low back should maintain contact with the floor throughout.
‚†Ä 
Video 3: Leg Raises.  Place block on opposite knee. Move through your full range of motion here without dropping the block. Low back stays flat in the ground.
‚†Ä 
Video 4: Leg Raise + Twist. Same as video 3 but this time we will test your ability to rotate. Keep abs in tight abs move through this without losing the block.üòÖ
‚†Ä 
If your able to do 10 or more on each side, congratulations, your deep abs are working!üëèüèª
‚†Ä 
If not, now you know where to start!üôåüèª
‚†Ä 
New moms, back backs, desk job or people who sit all day... you will really benefit from #Pilates!
‚†Ä 
#BYGMETHOD

Checkout my programs and learn to train your core! üëâüèªSave 40% and join for the year!
‚†Ä 
www.beachyogagirl.com üîó in bio!"

"üçëBookmark this post!üî• 5 resistance band exercises that blow your mind!ü§Ø
‚†Ä 
Adding a simple band to your #athomeworkouts will not only help you with muscle tone but also help you engage the deep core muscles!
‚†Ä 
Video 1:
LEAN BACK W/Tricep extension
Tips: keep the back straight. Draw navel in and don‚Äôt let the back arch or butt stick out. Exhale on the lean back as you extent the arm straight to work the tricep. These burn so go slowly ... pace yourself.üëçüèª
‚†Ä 
Video 2:
SCISSOR ‚úÇÔ∏è
Tips: your head can stay down and band can be around thighs to modify. You want to pull top leg in as you pull bottom leg away. Works #Psoas and #hamstring while working core like crazy.üôåüèª
‚†Ä 
Video 3:
DOWN DOG PULL
Tips: hook band around soles of the feet and exhale as you pull knee to tricep. These sneak up on you so be warned.üòÖ
‚†Ä 
Video 4:
BRIDGE UPS
Tips: place band around knee and sole of the foot as you lift hips up and bring opposite knee in. These will fire up the glutes like never before.üçëüî•
‚†Ä 
Video 5:
ONE LEG ü¶µüèª BRIDGE PULSE
Tips:  point your toe and pulse let up towards the sky. Do these after the Bridge Ups to really feel the burn. üòÖüî•
‚†Ä 
These are all in my NEW Quick Core class out on Monday! @beachyogadog also makes an appearance (watch my story from today)!
‚†Ä 
Join online and take my classes! #BYGMethod
www.beachyogagirl.com

Yesterday I returned from a two day trip to Albania seeing the damage of the earthquake first hand and meeting with those who are affected. I am sooo blown away by the heart and kindness of the people there, as well as everyone around the world who has been donating. WE CANNOT THANK YOU ENOUGH üôè. We have designated two houses damaged by the earthquake to rebuild, as a start. Please continue to spread awareness about this tragedy and the help that Albania needs. Happy bday daddy . . .
I recently took a photo trip to a well known location. One of those places where the map shows a little friendly camera icon.  I raced along with focused intent, anxious to arrive, hoping to catch evening light. But once there, I couldn‚Äôt convince myself to take any pictures. Feeling an impending sense of failure, I camped for the night. The next morning, aimlessly starting for home, I snapped a few photos along the way, just random things, small fascinations. Before long I found myself in full photo mode. Excitedly spinning u turns, hopping in and out with the tripod. Mid day light in the middle of nowhere.
I love going into the backcountry with loose intentions. Maybe I‚Äôll climb that peak, maybe I‚Äôll get some photos, maybe I‚Äôll stay a few more nights.
Floating about Idaho. A friend recently requested a cloud image for a project she was working on. They‚Äôre fun to make, and I was happy to have the excuse. Funny how it captures my summer too, a back to school paragraph, the gist of it, or at least the shadow is, sliding up and down sage hills, racing after distant floating things. Sometimes we‚Äôre just cats chasing laser beams, and that‚Äôs alright by me.
On a long enough time scale, everything is fluid.
"Holotropic. .
A while back on a sunny Sunday, I was stuck inside, injured and immobile, frustrated to say the least. Wondering if oxygen might help the healing, I started breathing, deep and full, and kept breathing that way, for a long while. Much more air than needed. What ended up happening was one of the more unique experiences of consciousness I can remember.  Partly because it was so unexpected. At first alarming, then beautiful. Apparently, as I learned years later, it‚Äôs a thing. The term Holotropic was coined by psychiatrist Stanislav Grof, and his method, which i‚Äôd stumbled into proximity of, was developed in the 1970‚Äôs after LSD was made illegal. Humans have been breathing for a while, so I‚Äôm guessing he wasn‚Äôt the first.
.
One of the perceptual changes I experienced was feeling, (not really seeing, but sensing) everything as tho made of vibrating particles. Like everything was made of sand, but in motion like the static on an old tv. The varying groups of particles held together by consciousness. I looked at my chair, that stout character, and marveled that I didn‚Äôt fall through to the floor. I thanked my cup for holding tea, laughed with the silver physio ball across the room, and cried when conversing with the injured part of my body. Then it was over, and I was laughing again, bemused and wondering what just happened."
"Travel without leaving.
.
This image is another experiment, constructed mostly out of a few small rocks and spray paint. The clouds are from Alaska.
.
I‚Äôm continuing to be fascinated by the idea of proactive vs reactive consciousness.  That we have the power to experience whatever feelings we want, independent of external conditions, or locations, simply through our choice of thoughts. In part, that‚Äôs what these scale experiments are about for me. If you want to feel a sense of awe you can really cultivate that anywhere. Yes, ‚ÄúThe mountains are calling‚Äù but so are small rocks. Perhaps Calvin and Hobbes said it best. ‚ÄúMagic is everywhere.‚Äù"
Color fascinates me. Just like music, our sense perception is related to vibration and velocity. Why does our nervous system react to wavelengths in such distinct emotional ways.
Going, and through.
"The conversations of passing formations. 
Halfway through a day long drive, I took a nap in the shade on the bench of a roadside picnic table. Clouds and trains whispered by on distant tracks of thought. Formations toward destinations, some on their way, and some already there."
One of my favorite Mountains, deconstructed and reconstructed in about 20 photos. I love playing with the interaction of shapes, the notan of light and dark. The time spent observing and the possibility of seeing something new. The closeness felt to a place I love. Only in retrospect, is there consideration of meaning, of audience perception, of the expectations within photography. Is this no longer real? Would that question exist in painting? What is real? Are memories only true when viewed in sequence, correctly delineated in the space of time? Can something imagined contain truth? Hemingway talked a lot about capital T truth, and he wrote fiction. Picasso pioneered cubist art, multiple perspectives shown simultaneously, searching for a deeper truth. I certainly look up to them in artistic admiration. (Regardless of their personal issues.) We seem to live in a crazy time when it comes to the collision of agreed upon realities. Perhaps intention is the most important part.
"The Great Inland Sea. A favorite of mine from the @Hasselblad book project last spring.
.
It‚Äôs a meta-scape of sorts. A landscape about the landscape, patterns repeated, mountains and waves, altered in scale or frozen in form."
Dragons tail. Walking in the woods, you find a small interesting branch. Following along, the branch winds and curves, it appears to be covered in scales of fascination. Your head is down, you focus intently, your excitement grows, the branch grows. You follow faster and faster. Silver spikes, what is this?! A dragon of course. Also, the creative process.

"#TheMoreYouKnow - Bikin Podcast cuma 5 menit, auto masuk Spotify.‚Å£
‚Å£
Netijen yang budiman, meskipun gue udah beberapa kali koar-koar tentang podcast, tapi netijen tetep aja banyak yang nanya gimana caranya bikin podcast, sekarang gue kasi tau lagi di sini ya. Singkat padat jelas üî•‚Å£
‚Å£
Gue bikin podcast cuma modal microphone, rekam suara pake smartphone-pun udah oke. Abis itu gue upload suaranya pake aplikasi Anchor (bisa via web, atau app, ada di App Store/Playstore). Nah si @anchor.fm ini gratis, jadi setelah kita upload podcast kita, Anchor akan otomatis ngedistribusiin podcast kita ke berbagai platform seperti Spotifyüéπ‚Å£
‚Å£
Di Anchor juga banyak tersedia backsound-backsound kalo bingung mau kasih lagu apa biar ga kesepian podcastnya üéô‚Å£
‚Å£
Buat yang mau sharing-sharing atau bikin konten, Podcast adalah salah satu cara paling effortless. Nggak perlu pikirin visual. Mau sambil tiduran, sambil mandi, nyuci baju, atau live report, tinggal rekam, upload, terus ajak temen-temen dengerin di Anchor/SpotifyüíÉüèªüï∫üèª‚Å£
‚Å£
Buat yang udah berhasil bikin podcast atau udah punya podcast, share nama podcastnya di komen ya!! üëçüèªüî•‚Å£
‚Å£
#workingwithanchor"

"Leani ‚ÄúNikki‚Äù Auxilio | 1992 - 2019

I first met Nikki when her mother Marivir used to take care of Mateo. That was ten years ago. 
Nikki came to live with us half of the week and work in our studio for over a year. She ate dinner with us. Cooked with us. Sometimes washed dishes with us. 
We tried to ween her off instant ramen noodles, but it was to no avail. We would sit around the table and see who could burp loudest. 
Nikki. Who knew the most useless facts about anime. 
Nikki.
Mateo and KK would endlessly ruin the endings of Marvel movies for her. But she didn‚Äôt seem to care. 
If the boys were too insane she zoned them out and played one of those innumerable massive multiplayer iPhone games. Like candy crush on steroids with an anime twist. 
There is all this office detritus that has Nikki‚Äôs hands all over it - small post it notes with her even smaller handwriting and doodles framing a few words of work still to be done. Wires from phones I don‚Äôt own. 
A book on how to spark revolution with baking soda.  Or something like that. 
Last year we took a cardboard table home from a photo event. Was sat it in our living room. And over weeks Nikki and all of us continued to draw on it with every pen and marker and crayon we had. Random doodles. Little characters. It‚Äôs was Nikki. To seeing the spark of creation in her pen. To see her hand bring to life her imagination. 
And that isn‚Äôt gone. That spark is still alive in all the people she has touched. In all the drawings she crafted.  It is In the love she had for everyone. 
The spark that drove her towards social justice.

There is a poem written about a  WWII resistance fighter who died fighting for her beliefs at the age of 23 that I thought would be appropriate.

There are stars whose radiance is visible on earth
though they have long been extinct.
There are people whose brilliance continues to light
the world even though they are not longer among the living‚Ä¶."

#film #underwaterphotography #documentary #sharks #sharkconservation #bealpha @sonyalpha"

"We are both thrilled and honored to share the magic, wonder, and importance of African wildlife and conservation through our new feature film, Okavango: River of Dreams (Directors Cut) at the 2020 @sundancefestival Much of the film features the landscapes and wildlife that we have spent our lives working in. "She‚Äôs got her paws full with these two. Little cubs need a lot of attention- and discipline. It‚Äôs an unforgiving world for a tiny lion who wanders off...
#okavangolions #bigcats #botswana #littlebigcats #wildlifephotography #africa #mothering #lioncub"
"It‚Äôs a wonderful tradition to give thanks and turn your mind from the pressures of the everyday to those magical moments, days and incidents whose shine gets brighter the more you focus on them.
I‚Äôm thankful to be here of course. The rigours of the buffalo attack have faded and my health has returned but that moment of life and death could easily have slipped into death had it not been for @dereckjoubert who would never give up on me. 
I‚Äôm so thankful to be able to spend my time back in the African bush with even more love for it and determination to do good by it and by the people who live out here together with wildlife and look towards the best way forward for man and beast. 
I‚Äôm thankful that the #RhinosWithoutBorders project is doing so well and we have welcomed dozens of babies ‚Äì born into a safer environment and I‚Äôm so thankful that so many people are supporting this and keeping them safe. 
There are many stresses on our wild places and their inhabitants and it‚Äôs easy to get bogged down in the challenges. But there are also so many talented and dedicated people who are working non-stop to ensure that wild places remain wild, that people and predators can co-exist, that people and elephants can live in harmony. And there are more and more people who are seeing the benefits of keeping the wilds wild as photographic tourists flock and jobs are created and the land remains more resilient to drought. 
For these things ‚Äì and so many more, I am so very thankful. 
#HappyThanksgiving"
Hippos are such important animals in environments like the Okavango. Not only do they create pathways through thick vegetation and reeds, but they help to maintain short grass lawns which are nutrient-rich and easily grazed by other animals. Birds love them too and stick close by while they disturb hordes of tasty insects... #keystonespecies #hippo #okavango #everythingislinked #botswana #megaherbivore #africa #wildlife #photography #upwiththesun #dawn
A herd moves through the wide open landscape of Duba Plains. Elephants on this Okavango island know that there is no threat to them from the few camera-wielding tourists, and their calm curiosity allows for wonderful, close moments with them. #thejoyofelephants #okavango #thisismytrophy #elephants #botswana #dubaplains #africa #wildlifephotography #matriarch #megaherbivore
Supple spines help little cubs bend over backwards in their efforts to outmaneuver their older siblings... #okavangolions #littlebigcats #playinggames #predatortraining #lions #wildlife #photography #botswana #okavango
"It's baby warthog season!

#greenseason #warthogs #newlife #botswana #linyanti #wildlife #photography #selinda #snuggles"
Ecosystems will tell you the stories of their inhabitants through trails and the shaping of vegetation.  Each species has an effect, although some are more evident than others. Hippos and elephants create paths through vegetation that others can follow, while tiny termites can help to create small island mounds, rich with trees and a dry refuge from high water. Unfortunately, our species‚Äô own footprint tends to be rather more obvious and much less green... #aerial #okavango #ecosystems #everythingislinked #botswana #wildlifetrails #keystonespecies #aerialphotography #landscapephotography #botswana
Dawn in the African bush; a cacophony of bird song, botanical scents, endless hues and if you're lucky, a patrolling predator.... #bigcats #thisismytrophy #okavangolions #lrf #lion #dawn #wildlife #photography #savannah #golden #upwiththesun #bestpartoftheday #Africa
When looking at big cats  we may associate play with young animals learning essential skills that will be necessary in later life. But with lions, the unusually social cats, games of chase will stay into adulthood and keep those social bonds tight. #bigcats #lions #okavangolions #botswana #chaseme #africa #wildlife #photography #animalbehavior #thisismytrophy #play

STORY TIME: The other day I stumbled behind the counter of a fish market to try and scrounge for some fish heads in the dumpster. It was then that the owner of the place caught me. His name was Captain Winslow. Instead of setting the dogs on me, Winslow decided to test me by having me catch a fish. I was as nervous as a field mouse in a den of snakes, but by Neptune‚Äôs trident, I caught the slippery son of a gun. It was then that Winslow decided that I have what it takes, so he gave me a job full time working at the fish market for ten cents an hour (before taxes). I hope this story has inspired you to follow your dreams, and hopefully one day you too will catch your fish.

Rediscovering my roots in Vietnam üõ∂ I did not expect the start of my trip to be as frustrating and stressful as it‚Äôs been. Why? Because I can barely communicate in a language that I grew up speaking. Here‚Äôs the thing with being born a child of an immigrant parent in the US - you live a double life. At home, you eat your cultural foods and you speak your mother and father‚Äôs native language. But when you go to school, you need to be as American as you can be so that the other kids won‚Äôt make fun of you, your parents‚Äô thick accent, or the smelly food you like to eat. So in a way, I‚Äôve unconsciously pushed away my Vietnamese heritage. What a stupid thing to do - to want to be like everyone else - to want to blend in and be same. Yet I can‚Äôt blame my child self for doing that because I get it...I get wanting to fit in. So now all I can do is reclaim my heritage by slowly relearning my language and embracing the culture and the country that my parents grew up in. It‚Äôs been a lovely adventure over here, and so wonderful to be able to speak a little more and learn a little more each day from my grandparents. üëµüèºüßìüèº Did anyone else grow up feeling this double identity? #blogilates
What‚Äôs your sign? Also I‚Äôm so happy to tell you that we‚Äôve officially launched sizes XS-3X (2-22) in this Zodiac set right here!!! It‚Äôs a test to see how this size range sells, and if y‚Äôall are eating it up, we‚Äôre gonna charge forward with the XS-3X range for all styles moving forward. I hope you love this collection guys. Everyone at the matcha cafe ordered one dessert and shared. @samlivits and I ordered 3 and shared. üòõ Many of you have been wondering how I‚Äôve been doing since the end of my 90 day journey and if I‚Äôve been able to maintain my weight. The answer is yes, I have. But with fluidity. There‚Äôs days where I lose weight, days where I gain weight, and days where I stay exactly the same! I‚Äôve experimented more with my food and I can with 100% confidence tell you that grains bloat me, the combination of dairy and sugar makes my skin inflame almost immediately (while we were eating this, Sam told me a pimple was developing around my mouth), and excessive calories make me gain fat and weight. These are cold hard FACTS about my body. Powered with this knowledge, I know exactly what I‚Äôm getting into when I get into it. When I make the decision to eat something, there is no feeling bad because my desire to eat it outweighs the consequences! Like, I will GLADLY eat a matcha crepe cake, a matcha cheesecake, and a matcha milkshake boba topped with matcha ice cream, corn flakes and a butter cookie on vacation - even if it means bumpy, red skin the next day. However, if I knew I had a photo shoot or video shoot that week, no, I would not make that decision. Food is fluid. Your body is fluid. Your decisions should be fluid too. Remember, there are seasons for intensity and seasons for relaxation. #blogilates #matchalover

BMW X6 M Competition: Fuel consumption in l/100 km (combined): 12.7‚Äì12.5. CO2 emissions in g/km (combined): 289‚Äì284. 
Acceleration (0-100 km/h): 3.8 s. Power: 460 kW, 625 hp, 750 Nm. Top speed (limited): 250 km/h (with optional M Drivers Package: 290 km/h). The values of fuel consumptions, CO2 emissions and energy consumptions shown were determined according to the European Regulation (EC) 715/2007 in the version applicable at the time of type approval. The figures refer to a vehicle with basic configuration in Germany and the range shown considers optional equipment and the different size of wheels and tires available on the selected model. The values of the vehicles are already based on the new WLTP regulation and are translated back into NEDC-equivalent values in order to ensure the comparison between the vehicles. [With respect to these vehicles, for vehicle related taxes or other duties based (at least inter alia) on CO2-emissions the CO2 values may differ to the values stated here.] The CO2 efficiency specifications are determined according to Directive 1999/94/EC and the European Regulation in its current version applicable. The values shown are based on the fuel consumption, CO2 values and energy consumptions according to the NEDC cycle for the classification. Further information on official fuel consumption figures and specific CO2 emission values of new passenger cars is included in the following guideline: 'Leitfaden √ºber den Kraftstoffverbrauch, die CO2-Emissionen und den Stromverbrauch neuer Personenkraftwagen' (Guide to the fuel economy, CO2 emissions and electric power consumption of new passenger cars), which can be obtained free of charge from all dealerships, from Deutsche Automobil Treuhand GmbH (DAT), Hellmuth-Hirth-Str. 1, 73760 Ostfildern-Scharnhausen and at https://www.dat.de/co2/."

"{ Empty Places of Italy } ‚Ä¢ Recently I‚Äôve checked out the number of ghost towns in Italy.
Each town has its own history, most of them disappear consumed by time.
The others remain alive thanks to small communities that live around them.

I‚Äôve been, with @playstationit, for the launch of #DeathStranding, in some of these, in a path as long as Italy. 1200km of discoveries and hopes. Stay connected to discover more.
.
üáÆüáπ ‚Ä¢ Di recente ho verificato quanti paesi abbandonati esistono in Italia. Non pochi. Ognuno di questi ha la propria storia, la maggior parte di questo svaniscono consumati dal tempo. Gli altri rimangono in piedi solo grazie alle piccole comunit√† che ci vivono intorno.

Just want to take a moment and congratulate my good friend (and barber) Chris, on 6 years of sobriety! Life ain‚Äôt easy, plain and simple. It tests us. It pokes at our insecurities. It has joyful highs and pressuring lows. But these experiences become a part of you. They‚Äôre that healed scar you become proud to show. A couple pages out of the long story we write, that is US. And we never really know what the next page holds but that‚Äôs what makes life, life. It‚Äôs yours. You own it and have to own what comes with that responsibility. It can be just as scary as it is exciting. Just as sad as it is happy. But those experiences are meant for you. We go through shit, we learn, we respond, we get stronger, we share that energy with the universe and keep moving forward. Thank you @no_class_in_first_class for being an example of that and inspiring me to continue chasing a better version of myself daily. #cashonly
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
A harp seal pup about 2 weeks old makes its first swim beneath pack ice while mom watches from behind. Photographed on assignment for @natgeo in the Gulf of St. Lawrence, Canada.
Historically these animals have thrived in this region, where come for a few weeks each year to engage in courtship, mating and pupping. But declining sea ice due to climate change over the last decade has caused problems for this species for without stable ice, the pups cannot suckle from their moms and may fall into the icy sea before they are physically prepared. Survival for this species is uncertain if these trends continue. 
#harp #seals #canada #climatechange #babyanimals"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry

A Humpback whale calf plays alongside its resting mom in the waters of the South Pacific. Humpback moms invest a lot into their offspring, with a gestation that lasts nearly a year and then spends the first year of the calf‚Äôs life teaching it all the skills it will need to survive in the sea. These bonds are strong and are an important element of whale culture. 
It is a privilege to be in the water and experience a scene like this. The tenderness and depth of feeling between mom and calf is palpable. Our planet is filled with such moments, we simply have to look ...
#whales #humpbackwhales #pacific #momandcalf #whaleculture"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
A humpback whale fills it gigantic mouth with herring and seawater in the chilly waters of the Norwegian Arctic. This whale surprised me in the dimly lit water, rocketing up from below, its mouth agape. The humpback‚Äôs throat pleats expand, allowing lots of fish and water to be taken inside. The water is pushed out through the baleen and only the fish remain.
#humpbackwhale #norway #feeding #behavior"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
My portrait of a Gray Seal in the Gulf of Maine, entitled ‚ÄòAin‚Äôt Misbehaving,‚Äô is now available in beautiful large format as a limited edition, signed and numbered fine art print! Available only from the @focus_gallery_chatham in Chatham, Massachusetts. 
To see the full collection of my prints at the Focus Gallery, follow the link in my profile.

This has always been one of my favorite images. I was diving off Acadia National Park in Maine and spent 5 hours in the chilly water the day I made this picture, loving every minute of being with these seals. In the beginning they were shy, but eventually built up their courage to come closer and eventually were biting on my fins! This guy stoped just long enough for me to make one picture, then swam off. 
#seals #gulfofmaine #maine #portrait #fineartprints"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
A beluga whale poses perfectly for this portrait the chilly waters off of Nova Scotia, Canada. Belugas are a highly social species, often called the ‚Äòcanaries of the sea‚Äô for their diverse repertoire of whistles, clicks and other sounds. They are also known to mimic sounds that they hear, including boat engines and other sounds.
Though these gorgeous creatures live in the Arctic, they frequently move into Sub-Arctic waters as well. They are one of the only whale species capable of turning their necks in all directions.
#beluga #whale"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry

A sperm whale mom lies upside down beneath the surface as her new calf nurses in the waters of the Eastern Caribbean Sea. Portrayed as monsters for centuries, researchers today know that these animals and their societies are far more complex than ever believed. To sperm whales, families are very important. They are led by older, wise females that make decisions for the family unit.

In the time that I have spent with these animals, I have been amazed at their tenderness to one another. Most of their lives are spent in the deep, dark and cold sea and it seems that they truly relish these social gatherings in shallow water. I have observed what can only be described as joy when they socialize with each other.

Coverage from my upcoming work with @Natgeo

#spermwhales #whaleculture #caribbean #whales with @shanegero"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
Orca Sunrise - A family of orca cruise the surface waters of the Norwegian Arctic at sunrise. They migrate into fiords in this region during late fall and winter to feed on herring that often overwinter here. Light levels are low during this time and by late November the ‚ÄòPolar Night‚Äô occurs, with weeks on end of darkness. 
#whaleculture #orca #norway #arctic"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry

A Humpback whale calf swims above its mom as two male escorts follow along in the waters off the Cook Islands. They had spent a few days in the shallow, protected waters around the islands and were now heading out to open sea. Humpback moms invest a lot into their offspring, with a gestation that lasts nearly a year and then spends the first year of the calf‚Äôs life teaching it all the skills it will need to survive in the sea. These bonds are strong and are an important element of whale culture. This population of humpbacks feed in Antarctic waters during the summer, then migrate to the South Pacific in winter  to have their calves. 
Being allowed into the world of these animals is a privilege and never ceases to be exhilarating for me! Coverage from my on going project for @natgeo
#whales #humpbackwhales #pacific #momandcalf #whaleculture"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
An Orca about to eat a herring in the waters of the Norwegian Arctic. Orca migrate into fiords in this region during late fall and winter to feed on herring that often overwinter here. The orca work cooperatively to ‚Äòcorral‚Äô herring into bait balls, then slice through the school, stunning the fish with a whack of their tails, them come back to feed. In late November the ‚ÄòPolar Night‚Äô occurs, with weeks on end of darkness. Successful feeding by the orca involves complex communications and echolocation. Specialized feeding strategies such as this are examples of culture found among whale and dolphin families.
#orca #norway #whaleculture #smartanimals"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry

A sperm whale calf, with its mouth open, swims amongst her family in the waters of the Eastern Caribbean Sea. With the largest brain of all animals on Earth, they are also our planet‚Äôs largest predator. Portrayed as monsters for centuries, researchers today are learning that these animals and their societies are far more complex than ever believed. To sperm whales, families are very important. They are led by older, wise females that make decisions for the family unit.

In the time that I have spent with these animals, I have been amazed at their tenderness to one another and have observed what can only be described as joy when they socialize with each other.

Coverage from my upcoming work with @Natgeo

#spermwhales #whaleculture #caribbean #whales"
"Photo by @BrianSkerry
A Humpback Whale calf lifts its head out of the water to have a a look at me as it swims past my boat in the waters of the South Pacific. This calf‚Äôs mom spent the summer in Antarctica, feeding in those rich and chilly waters, then migrated to the warm waters of the South Pacific to give birth. Humpback moms invest a great deal in their offspring, with a gestation period that last about a year and during the first year of the calf‚Äôs life, mom teaches it the things it will need to know to survive. Research shows that humpback mothers even‚Äô whisper‚Äô to their calves in places where predators might otherwise hear them. What we know about these animals is only a small fraction of their culture and complex lives.
#humpbackwhales #southpacific #moms #whaleculture"

"Splits ARE hard! But they also feel oh so good ü•∞.... when done right. Working towards #hanumanasana is a journey, much like preparing to handstand, and it‚Äôs important that you not only take your time in working towards them but that you prepare correctly to prevent injuries. I‚Äôm a fan of incorporating splits into my practice for a stretch and I came up with a 12 minute flow that really hits all the spots needed to work towards the splits. One blank canvas. One creative vision. Follow the Making of the Chiron 'Zebra 1 of 1'. #BUGATTI #BUGATTIChiron #Chiron #ChironZebraOneOfOne
"The Chiron Noire features an all black interior. Only the speedometer glows in its usual BUGATTI bleu.

.

.

"Kemarin aku dan Ansara hadir di #MYBABYMomversity. Acaranya bikin Ansara bisa cobain banyak arena permainan yang seru banget dan ikut kelas MY BABY Lovely Spa. Acara ini dipersembahkan oleh @mybabyid sebagai wadah untuk Ibu menambah ilmu agar makin menikmati perannya, mulai dari cara pijat bayi yang benar, olahraga sama anak, serta mengajarkan Ibu dalam mengatur keuangan. Bermanfaat sekali! Terima kasih MY BABY untuk ilmu serta keseruannya üòä
#MYBABYMomversity"
Walaupun kadang susah, tapi aku membiasakan untuk percaya sama Ansara ketika dia mau mengeksplorasi lingkungan baru. Memang sih deg-degan takut dia jatuh atau kepentok, tapi kalaupun jatoh atau kepentok kan dia jadi belajar kalau memang harus lebih memperhatikan kemana dia jalan dan jadi lebih bisa mengenal kapasitas dirinya. Tapi tetep selau dalam pengawasan ya, jadi Ansara juga merasa aman setiap melihat reaksi atau respon Ibunya yang selalu menyemangati ketika Ia mau mencoba hal yang baru. Kalau kalian bagaimana menghadapi anak yang mau coba segalanya sendiri? #parentingtips #parenting
Ini foto di saat kita masih obsesi banget sama Tante @anggun_cipta , sampai maunya pakai baju ala rocker, rebutan topi dan sepatu boots untuk meniru gayanya. Untung jaket jeans belel-nya kita punya masing-masing. Kalo enggak, mungkin udah rebutan. Gitulah rasanya punya sister yang bedanya cuma 1 tahun (lebih 3 bulan). Selalu jadi temen main, temen curhat, temen rebutan, temen berantem, temen ketawa, temen nangis, and a friend to share many other wonderful things in life you can only understand when you have one. Kalo dulu lagi akur rasanya selalu jadiin Mba Gigi panutan, kalo lagi sebel langsung deh jambak-jambakan üôà Eiiitttss, tapi kalo ada yang berani jambak rambut Mba Gigi sampe dia nangis dan ngadu ke aku, langsung aku samperin dan jambak balik orang itu! ü§£ Agak lebay sih protective-nya, tapi yah waktu itu kan masih belum dewasa cara berpikirnya. Sekarang sih udah banyak kok jalan yang lebih bijak untuk menghadapi bullying. Iya gak? Karena tangan kita cuma 2 buat nutupin ribuan mulut orang yang bisa bicara seenaknya ke kita, tapi hati dan pikiran kita itu cuma kita yang bisa kendalikan. Yakinkan ke diri sendiri bahwa diri kita berarti dan jangan pernah lupa bersyukur. Trik itu membantu aku dalam menjalani keseharian aku yang ga luput dari hate comments and bullying. Kalo mereka ga mikirin dampak omongan mereka kenapa kita harus mikirin mereka? Kalo kalian biasanya gimana menghadapi perundungan atau bullying? Bales atau doain aja? Share dong trik tetep sehat mental menghadapi bullying ala kalian! üòä
"Ansara lagi suka banget sama dunia hewan, mulai dari boneka sampai wujud aslinya. Lagi sering banget Ansara niruin suara-suaranya atau minta main sama binatang peliharaan. 
Kemarin pas Ansara ulang tahun kita nginep di hotel dalam aquarium besar yanh banyak ikan-ikan laut. Memang sih pada dasarnya aku dan Mas @barry.tamin juga suka binatang, jadi membiasakan sayang binatang ga sulit buat kami. Nah, aku mau tau dong #TIPSIbuCerdasMYBABY dari Moms yang lain.

Ceritakan #TIPSIbuCerdasMYBABY versi kamu dan dapatkan kesempatan datang ke inspiring class #MYBABYMomversity dengan para pembicara @pritaghozie dari @zapfinance , @ardianti dari @fitmumandbub dan @tiurbeuwtie (IAIM International Trainer), serta hadiah menarik lainnya!
.

1. Upload foto Ibu dan si Kecil dengan caption yang menceritakan #TIPSIbuCerdasMYBABY dalam hal
parenting
2. Tag dan mention @mybabyid serta beri hashtag #TIPSIbuCerdasMYBABY
3. Isi data diri dengan klik link bio @mybabyid
4. Periode kompetisinya cuma sampai besok aja lho!
5. Info selengkapnya cek instagram @mybabyid ya!

Buruan Ikutan ya Moms!"

"An adventurous Lil‚Äô Lady ‚ù§Ô∏è Ansara yang lagi ekspresif banget dan suka nyobain hal-hal baru. Karena kita percaya banget kalau anak itu pasti lihat reaksi orang tuanya ketika coba hal yang belum familiar. Kalau kitanya happy pasti dia akan lebih percaya diri untuk nyobain dan explore hal yang baru dia kenali. Kadang emang deg-degan sih, tapi aku tetep meyakinkan diri kalau aku harus percaya sama Ansara. Tiap malem juga aku biasain bilang terima kasih ke Ansara udah baik sama Ibu dan ingetin hal-hal baik yang dia lakuin di hari itu. Juga minta maaf kalau Ibu ada salah sama Ansara. i‚Äôm posting later than i wanted to but the t-shirt just came in üôèüèΩ today is #latinaequalpay day, when latinas "catch up" to what white, non-latino men were paid in 2018. the gap is widest for latina workers, who on average earn only 54 cents for every $1 a man is paid. meaning they must work nearly two years to earn what white men earn in one year. this is unacceptable, and we need to act now. @phenomenal tee benefits @mujerxsrising, which protects the rights of migrant women. truffle and i are in full support!! #latinapower

This special edition Ford Mustang features the Gulf Heritage livery that were worn by the GT40s that won the 1968 and 1969 24 Hours of Le Mans. It also produces 800 horsepower and hits 60 MPH in just 3.5 seconds. It can be ordered with a manual or automatic transmission, and includes an upgraded suspension, carbon-fiber splitter, Brembo brakes, and a wicker-bill spoiler. A more aggressive track package with a rear wing and upgraded orange wheels is also available. Only 119 will be made in coupe or convertible form for $139,995. Thoughts?
Christmas came early for 13 customers who took delivery of their Porsche 935 at Portimao last week. The Porsche 935 pays tribute to the 935 racecar from the 1970s, and is a track only racecar just like the original 935. The design cues come from the original 935, but with a modern take. It is based off the modern GT2RS with 700 horsepower. Only 77 will be made to celebrate Porsche's 70th birthday. Thoughts on the 935? üì∏ @stephan_bauer
The Dubai police have posted on their Instagram that they will be adding a Cybertruck to their high end lineup of police cars. The 0-60 time of under 3 seconds for the tri motor AWD can definitely be helpful in high speed chases. As well as the 14,000 towing capacity for any police trailers. The Armored body and windows also can shield the car from bullets. Thoughts on this addition to the Dubai police car lineup?
BMW introduced the 3.0 CSL in 1972 as a lightweight homologation special off the 3.0 CS sporting coupe. The CLS weighed approximately 450 pounds lighter than the CS and obtained the nickname Batmobile based off its looks. The aerodynamic package include fins running along the top of the front fenders, a spoiler on the edge of the roof, and a tall rear wing. The rear wing was actually not installed by the factory, as wings were illegal on German roads at the time. It was left in the trunk in three parts for the owner to install. Thoughts? üì∏ @alexpenfold
Volkswagen is headed for the 2020 Baja 1000 with a 480 horsepower Atlas Cross Sport R. The suv coupe almost barely resembles the regular Atlas Cross sport with an open fender and off road design. It is powered by a turbocharged four-cylinder engine that produces 480 horsepower. The truck is still in development, but it will be the first four-wheel-drive machine to race in Baja Class 7 competition. Thoughts?
Nissan and Italdesign design have unveiled the production version of the GT-R50, built to commemorate 50 years of the GTR and Italdesign. Only 50 will be made, with a few available slots left and each are completely customized by the customer. Most of the changes are in the exterior design as the GT-R50 is based off the GTR Nismo. They go for around $1.1. Million each. Thoughts?
The Karma S2 concept is an all electric concept meant to represent the future of the brand. Karma currently only produces the Revero, based on the Fisker. The S2 posts impressive numbers with 1,100 horsepower and a 350 mile range. The most unusual feature of the S2 has to be its "re-live" feature that turns the S2 into a simulator after your last drive and allows you to re-live your last drive to improve your skills. Thoughts?
The new Porsche Speedster can be speced with a heritage look for the extra cash of $24,150. The Heritage design package includes a silver and white livery inspired by the classic Porsche 356 Speedsters which were commonly raced. Only 1948 911 Speedsters will be made in tribute to the year Porsche was found. Thoughts on the Heritage livery? üì∏ @ivanorlov
The 2021 Kia Seltos will be coming to the U.S. for its second year of existence as Kia's rugged looking and roomy SUV. The Seltos offers plenty of headroom and legroom in the front and even rear seats that offer heated and the reclinable seats. The eight-inch or 10.2-inch touchscreen infotainment system runs Kia's UVO system¬†with Android Auto and Apple Car play. Thoughts on this vehicle from Kia?

El ni√±o de Medell√≠n
A week of art, palm trees and mental health talks in the books - Saw tons of art, did a tough hot Pilates class (my abs are still sore,) got to chat about burnout (and the long term health effects of it,) finished my fall semester and #ToeGang got to see me in heel sandals. A full week indeed of risks and rewards.
Today was a good day. Thank you @createcultivate for allowing me space to chat about burnout this afternoon. I'm grateful for the space to share what matters most to me - truly helping people to feel better and live more full and calm lives thru understanding mental health and applying it in real world ways. Thanks to everyone who came out! Love y'all long time üïäüïäüïä
Wrote down my goals for 2020 earlier this week and one of them was produce less waste and use even less plastic (already do no plastic bags, but so much else to be mindful of, like water, thank you @drinkeverandever üôèüèΩ) - great panel tonight with @lonelywhale @miamibeachedition at The Museum of Plastic discussing ways to reduce plastic and take way better care of our planet and selves.
grown woman ways. üïä
A woman and some weights. Not much makes me happier than lifting and feeling strong. It's where I get to focus, feel renewed, appreciate my body for what it can do, and reflect on how many times I've thrown weights around (must be thousands by now, with 2 decades of lifting coming up.) Super excited about December workouts. Any one else look forward to the gym?
Made it thru #thanksgiving and heading to some sunshine üòù
A follower once told me I ‚Äúlooked lonely‚Äù Bc I was in Mexico for thanksgiving vs being with family. Best believe I was not sad lounging in the sun with a margarita that year. The problem with the original assumption is that it plays into the notion holidays are only valuable if spent the way society defines. I will be happily spending time with my family in the ways we dictate work for us this year but there truly are no right or wrong ways to spend a holiday. Holidays can mean whatever you want them to (including nothing at all, I know, unpopular opinion 101 but I champion people dictating what kind of lives they want to live, and being accepting and kind of themselves and others along the way.) I'm really glad boundaries are finally getting popular but I'm more so glad people are finding healing and peace in whatever situations (life and family) they might be in. Currently stocking up on toast options and chugging strong hot tea with a week full of people I love. A good week indeed.
I don't know if younger me knew this level of peaceful contentment was possible. Maybe that's a big part of what this life thing is about, taking all the pieces and parts and experiences, good and bad; then building something younger you would be in awe of.
Someone asked me yesterday what an emotional connection looked like (which I know can be difficult when we are often taught to measure who we love based on a list of external factors, traits, and/or accomplishments) - but an emotional connection (IMO) is one based on seeing and being seen with and by another person. It's a place where you feel safe to be yourself, express yourself, and trust the relationship is not fair-weathered and gives space to grow, change, evolve, and even make mistakes (which all us humans do.) Secure connection is another name for this, and it's one of the things that makes us human; our ability to connect with another and our need for (hello bonding science) or even our longing for connection. üñ§ Happy Friday gang, I'm exhausted but my heart is well.
Simultaneously trying to lift and watch the impeachment hearings. First workout in almost 3 weeks: body is as happy as it is unhappy. But knowing strength comes right back is reassuring.
"Oh hi. Claire here. Been taking some much needed #metime but here are some fun catch up facts:
1) Turned 34 in Oct. and it‚Äôs been amazing. 
2) Haven‚Äôt been to the gym in over 3 weeks and am ok with it. 
3) Did teach a fun yoga class with @coxcommunications tho. 
4) Been on thirteen flights in two weeks. 
5) @vitacoco helps me year-round with hydration, especially when I work out. 
6) Currently seeing clients as part of my final masters work and LMHC licensure process. 
7) Speaking with @createcultivate Vision Summit on Dec.7th - come say hi. 
8) My beloved @moonlitskincare is at @anthropologie now (cop!) 9) Going to sleep at 9:30pm is a game changer. 
10) Making a new book list for all of y‚Äôall as well. 
I hope I can be an example of how much life is lived off these screens and empower all of you to know you're worthy and valid, even if none of it ever gets posted, or hell, any pictures taken. Love and life is not only possible without speaking publicly about it, but, perhaps, often times even enriched by protecting it. Fit by @underarmourwomen"
I‚Äôm very sad to hear my good friend @bradgobright has died in a climbing accident in Mexico.  Besides being an absolutely legendary climber, Brad was an incredibly sweet and earnest human being, who was always a pleasure to be around.  I don‚Äôt have a lot of words right now other than to say that Brad is very missed, and my heart goes out to his friends and family.  I really loved and was inspired by Brad.  He was an exceptional human.
My smart, beautiful, rock crusher wife @nmilfeld has completed a long time dream of free climbing The Free Rider leading every pitch. I got a front row seat supporting her, which entailed...jumaring every pitch with a monster pack, organizing the rope and gear at each belay, massaging her forearms, giving her pep talks, and mostly doing my best impression of a patient human being.  For those of you who have climbed with me, you may know that I get a little antsy once I'm on the wall.  Probably my least supportive moment was on the first enduro corner when I bolstered Nellie with the encouraging words, "you've got to be kidding me," when she botched a gear placement and had to put it back on her harness and select the correct cam...what can I say... I'm a work in progress!  Having free climbed the route twice back in the olden days, first wall style then in a day... I was surprised to remember unhelpfully little about the route... except that you need lots of slings for the sewer pitch... beta I repeated to Nellie with annoying frequency.  Highlights included watching Nellie absolutely style The Monster Offwidth.  Probably the turning point was on day three when Nellie fell off the boulder problem.  She came back down to the anchor and in a moment of anxiety that her dream may be shriveling up,  blurted out the positive affirmation... "I can't do this.. we should just go down." "Oh... there is only one way we are going honey," I assured her, pointing to the summit.  Nellie composed herself and then with a bit of power screaming, fired the crux of the Freerider!  After twenty years climbing in Yosemite, this was one of the best weeks there of my life which started by putting up the best first free ascent I have ever done with @lucho_rivera and then culminated with supporting the love of my life in achieving what will always be one of the greatest, most iconic achievements in rock climbing... free climbing el cap.  So..Here is to Sending!! Here is to my bad ass wife who holds down a full time job as a criminal defense lawyer, while finding time to crush the stone at a professional level!!! Woohooo!  Also.. thanks to @danieljoll for the first top down photo.
Ha!! Oops!  I posted this a no caption!  Go to  @pictures_of_fidelman to purchase the StoneNudes book.  It is epic.  I‚Äôm in there naked... worth the cost alone!
We SENT!!!!! Ten pitches of incredible crack and face climbing that is continuous, outrageous, and gorgeous! @lucho_rivera and I are happy to report there is officially a new hard free route on FiFi Butress and we are calling it ‚ÄúThe Dream Team‚Äù 5.13a.  Of the ten pitches 6 are in the solid 5.12 range and the hardest 2 pitches are right at the top...so for this paragliding pilot... it was a ballistic effort.  By some small miracle It was a no falls day for me except for on the easiest 5.11a pitch where I unexpectedly slipped and flipped upside down with my head missing the belay ledge by about 5 feet! üò¨ It was a short lower to lead the pitch clean!  We are calling the route The Dream Team as a kind of tongue in cheek poke at the fact that Austin, Tommy and Alex managed a new free route on the dawn wall in less time then our much better but much shorter FiFi route... but also because Lucho and I have established some dream routes over the years here in Yosemite, and it really has been an all time climbing partnership for me that has spanned two decades!  We didn‚Äôt have a fancy pro photographer with us... because he was with Alex and Tommy üòúand Now I‚Äôm up on El Cap supporting my lovely wife @nmilfed on The FreeRider... then it‚Äôs a quick turn around to paragliding In Mexico and Chile... but hopefully in the spring we can get some photo and video of what I think is a modern Yosemite Classic! @thenorthface @fattire @fiveten_official @thenorthface_climb
Another shot of @lucho_rivera from our free route in progress... which blazes totally new terrain to the 2/3s height on FiFi where it joins 9-11 established by Dan McDevitt and pioneered for free climbing by our friends Trevor and Margaret who are graciously letting us free the last few pitches of their free project.... if In fact we can accomplish that before nov10 when I head to Oaxaca Mexico and then Chile for  some paragliding adventures!  The route is pretty stacked with 7 or 8 of the 10 pitches being solid 5.12, and one of the last pitches being maybe 5.13.  It‚Äôs going to be a lot to ask of our forearms!  Wish us luck.  It‚Äôs been super awesome to be here in Yosemite which still feels like home after a 3 year break!  @thenorthface @thenorthface_climb @fattire @fiveten_official
For the last couple weeks @lucho_rivera and I have been working on a new free climb on FiFi Buttress here in Yosemite.  Lucho and I have put up some classic first ascents together over the years mostly in Yosemite but also in Malaysia.  While we hadn‚Äôt seen each other in a few years, we picked up right where we left off!  Lucho is a true Yosemite legend, a great first ascent adventure climber who escaped gang life in the bay during his high school years when he discovered Yosemite climbing through a program for troubled youth.  It‚Äôs been refreshing to put down the paraglider  for a bit and get back to the roots.... and routes üòúreconnecting with one of my oldest and best climbing friends and doing what I love to do most In climbing... charging  headlong into unexplored territory!  Right now there is a lot of work to do to get the route ready for a send burn, but it‚Äôs pretty damn stacked with 5 5.12 pitches and one pitch that is probably 13a.... and most importantly the climbing is steep, varied and beautiful.  I think we are putting together a modern classic!  Woohoo!  @thenorthface @fattire @fiveten_official  #neverstopexploring #neverstophanddrilling
Aspiring ski mountaineer and part time nude model @alexhonnold approaches the the gnar gnar in Antarctica.  You probably haven‚Äôt noticed that @thenorthface is launching a new waterproof breathable technology üòú called #FutureLight  or maybe your feed is exploding! Check out my Story for more info.... but the short version is... it‚Äôs a new level in breathable for a waterproof fabric that is soft to the skin!  And even better, it is made from recycled material.  It‚Äôs a good time to be a TNF athlete!!! #neverstopexploring
Photo @jennflemm ...My extraordinary lawyer/climber wife @nmilfeld has red pointed her first 5.13c ...China Doll!  Her ability to excel in both her professional and athletic life is impressive. Just last week she was in the heat of a high stakes criminal trial and this week she clipped the chains on her hardest climb.... a unique linkup! Those who are lucky enough to have Nellie in their life, know her as a sweet and loyal friend who loves her whiskey cocktails, and stops to pet every dog in her path.  A true gem of a human üíé ü•∞ love ya Nellie.ü§™
Don't forget where you came from... In my case right off the set of saved by the bell...HA!  This is my Senior photo!  A few years after this was taken I got into climbing and found my path in life...but at this particular moment in time I was pretty aimless, depressed and desperately wanting to be cool.  High School wasn't the best time for me, (*IT SUCKED) and I split my late teens kind of torn between worlds... sometimes hanging out the with my fellow band geeks and dungeons and dragons dorks and then the next minute trying to be one of the "cool kids," but never quite making the cut.  For kids, or people of any age really.. who are struggling right now.. who feel like they don't fit in...just know that you aren't alone and that life can get better.. amazing even.  Looking back at this kind of sad, earnest kid, I'm super grateful to be able to definitively say that things got WAY better.  I squeezed the juice out of life, traveled the world, climbed on and flew over some outrageous terrain.. fell in love...and generally made life a great one.  And.. I've still got a lot of gas in the tank; motivation for big adventures, and big laughs with the people I love.  This sad bad dressed kid was the seed for a happy man.  So if you are feeling depressed, hopeless or like you don't fit in... that can pass.  But, unfortunately, if you wear an outfit like this and get your senior picture taken... well.... that is forever!
Please click the Link in my Profile!  Do you have a friend who is a master of self sabotage?  I do!  Last year things were finally looking up for my old friend and O.G. Mega-Dirtbag Stonemaster @pitcures_of_fidelman After years of losing money on his "Stone Nudes," calendar and books, which he shot with the tragic diligence of a tortured artist...all on film with... a Medium Format Pentax... Dean had finally gotten a break!  I got together with my old friend @renan_ozturk and together we made an effort to really promote Dean's 20th and last stone nude calendar.  The promotion went a bit viral and next thing you know Dean had sold over 30k in calendars and his instagram following had ballooned from the hundreds to over 13k!  Finally it looked like Dean was going to enjoy some much deserved belated success, and in an unexpected turn, Renan generously gave Dean a Sony A7rii, which would mark the first time that Bullwinkle got to shoot digital.  It was pretty hilarious to watch this old dirtbag enthralled by the magic of being able to instantly see your photos, as he arrived 20 years late to the digital photography party!  It was like watching a caveman see fire for the first time. "what sorcery is this?" And So..it appeared....Dean was enjoying a bit of a renaissance... shooting in color for the first time, and exploring outside of climbing nudes into silk nudes and slackline nudes!  With a ganja smoke induced excitement Dean began posting his uncensored nudes on his insta! I warned him that this was a bad idea, but Dean doubled down with the zealous middle fingers in the air defiance that was characteristic of the stonemaster era of climbing.  It wasn't long before Instagram gave up on pulling down his nudes and just erased his account!  With thirteen thousand less people to sell his work to, and a departure from climbing which was really his main audience Dean had set himself up for a return to his roots as a broke and tortured artist!  Jeeze! This is my last ditch effort to save Dean from himself.  Please support his latest "Photos of Fidelman" project on kickstarter, so that I don't end up with Dean living in my basement and eating my leftovers!  Please!!!
Who wants $30k to temporarily ‚Äúquit‚Äù their job?!?! I'm running this #sponsored post with @StoKcoldbrew to #SToKYourDreams with 30 grand in cash + travel!  Go to QuitYourJobAndGetSToKed dot com to find out more. I've been living the care free sponsored lifestyle for a long time now... paragliding, climbing, and generally being one of those annoying people on social media who never seem to work (sorry about that!) But...Now is your chance to join the club and chase after a crazy dream! Find out more in my story Woohoo!!!
